author: {'steamid': '76561198068521118', 'num_games_owned': 902, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1673743909}
review:
The game is demanding, on par with similar games from the NES and SNES era, so sometimes it may even feel frustratingly unfair, but I eventually found the progression system rewarding and felt like my character is going forward without too much grind and/or repeating the same part over and over. Although at its core the game can be enjoyed, I wish the loot would be much more frequent and varied, the trade system more balanced in terms of item prices, and a higher emphasis on developing a magic-oriented character would be put, as the available spells never felt to able to reach the point where you wouldn’t need to rely on using regular weapons. Or at least give us a new game+ mode, that alone would make future playthroughs much more enjoyable! 

In short: Highly recommended for fans of oldschool metroidvania platformers, who expect a challenge. While not perfect, It still offers a fairly enjoyable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063241093', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1673144211}
review: I recently played this as part of my YouTube series going through my backlog of games. Chasm is a game that has a great premise; a metroidvania that is procedurally-generated in order to make each playthrough unique. Sounds great. It isn’t. Due to the random nature, interesting secrets or loot is few and far between. Fortunately, the combat is where the game shines; it feels tight and responsive with multiple types of weapons and enemies for you to learn. The pixel art graphics are great with the only downside being that your equipment is not visible which is a real let down. The music is also very solid albeit a bit short with one main track per area but there is a toggle option to enable a chiptune version for some variety. Overall I would give this game a 6.5/10 definitely buy it on sale and give it a try if you’re a fan of this style of game but it’s not exactly my cuppa tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198337835970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1081, 'last_played': 1685363746}
review:
Chasm est un jeu sans grande ambition mais qui fait bien le travail.

J'ai été d'abord attiré par le côté Metroidvania du jeu, et sur ce point-là il est plutôt décevant: vous arrivez dans un village vide et entrez par la porte des mines, pour explorer des environnements souterrains (pas très nombreux et complété dans un ordre précis) dans le but de sauver des villageois et battre quelques boss et sous-boss. Il n'y a pas beaucoup d'endroits uniques et intéressant, ça se résume très souvent à avancer en battant des ennemis et en traversant des phases de plateformes pour arriver au boss, à un bouton ouvrant une porte ou à un accessoire qui augmentera votre palette de mouvement.

Cependant, les combats sont plutôt sympa (surtout avec une dague comme arme selon moi), le bestiaire est varié, le pixel art est vraiment beau surtout dans le village, le jeu est accessible (voire trop simple même en mode difficile pour ceux qui cherchent du challenge, une fois les potions débloquées on peut spammer les soins et les attaques ennemies sont toutes esquivables facilement quand on connait), les armes principales et secondaires sont sympas à utiliser et les boss sont cool à affronter.

Pour finir, le jeu se veut avec une grande rejouabilité, où vous débloquerez le système de classe de départ (guerrier, mage, voleur) après la première victoire sur le jeu et sa génération procédurale qui ne se ressent pas vraiment à la première partie mais fais plaisir pour les prochaines, si vous avez toutefois envie de refaire le jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354010171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 5233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5233, 'last_played': 1672664042}
review:
実績コンプしての評価です。

・良いと感じた事
操作性が良く、探索中にダメージを受けた時には何かしらの原因があり
改善すればノーダメージで行けるという納得が出来る事。

武器の種類によって戦法が変わり楽しめた。

最初はスキルが低くてマップの移動に制限があるが
特定のアイテム入手でストレスが一気に解放される事。

マップにマーキング出来るので気になるポイントでマークして
後で探索しやすい事。


・物足りないと感じた事
日本語非対応なので、お使いイベントで〇〇を◆個持って来いという事が読み取りにくく
苦労しました。

クリアしてしまうと やる事が無くなります。
より強いアイテムを手に入れてタイムを縮めるとか
強い状態のまま最初からスタートしたり
無限ダンジョンで地下何階まで潜れるとかの要素があれば
なお良かったと思います。


・総評
外国語が苦手でない方や、若干グーグル翻訳する苦労を覚悟出来る方にはお勧めします。
販売金額と内容が釣り合うかどうかは ほんの少しだけ疑問があります。
セール中ならいいね。

author: {'steamid': '76561198202981520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1983, 'last_played': 1670720775}
review: Solid classic style metroidvania. I think that the mechanics were pretty well done even if the movement is a little clunky at first. Also the pixel art is beautiful. Definitely one of my favorite parts of the game. I think there are certain things that aren't very well explained and could have benefited from maybe a help/tutorial section in the menu to explain things. That way if people wanted the fully immersed experience that I think the devs were going for, they could still have that by just not looking at that menu and figuring it out themselves. I think the reliance on enemy drops and random chance for the progression of your equipment outside of the very limited shops is a somewhat poor choice. I was near the end of the game before I was able to upgrade my spells, although I appreciate the ability to quick swap between them. Also the very limited shop selection that never refreshes itself is not great either. If you don't do what I did, which is saving pretty much all your consumables for bosses, then you will easily find yourself only able to rely on the potion seller for healing in combat. Also I think that certain NPC questlines were a bit lackluster and underdeveloped, not to mention the cooldown on the mana pool in town. Would it really hurt to be able to let your players experiment with their spells freely in the hub area? Overall, it is a good game, but some issues that could be solved through either updates or a sequel. Worth the price, but it is a close thing.

review:
7 из 10

Неплохая метроидвания аля snes, ps1. Однако привыкал долговато, из-за этого не раз ловил эмоциональные возгорания в процессе. 
Самый момент который возмущал это то, что ты не можешь двигаться, пока анимация удара не закончится. Видимо у меня уже есть привычка к неким стандартам подвижности главного героя в платформерах. Еще очень важно своевременно забегать в места сохранения, ибо при смерти теряешь все, а у меня бывало что шастал по игре больше часа без сохранения и когда случайно погибал, было чертовски обидно, все открывать собирать заново. Некоторые вещи полезные вещи из врагов выпадают случайно, потому можно какую то крутую штуку потерять практически безвозвратно. 
Но когда нормально прокачиваешься, привыкаешь к врагам и к управлению то играть нормально. И в целом играть интересно, и сама игра не сложная. 
Секретов конечно хотелось бы побольше :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198099102768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1668475603}
review:
I might finish this game, despite the negative review.  It's going to take awhile to finish though because it has some major issues that leave me wanting to put it down not long after I pick it up.  It has a lot of the things I desperately want that developers refuse to put out.  It's not a roguelike, which it feels like every game like this these days is a roguelike that acts like the ability to save is going to ruin the experience.  It has a lot of old school SNES type mechanics, some good, some very dated.

The Pros are it looks great, the art and assets are all nicely done, it has an inoffensive soundtrack, and I haven't encountered any bugs of glitches in my time playing so far.  It plays well and the controls are responsive, mostly.  The story isn't anything crazy unique, but it's honestly not bad for the era that this game emulates.  I want a hack n' slash platformer, metroidvania experience.  This game does that.  It also has some insanely glaring flaws though that leave me extremely frustrated.

The cons aren't all that many to list, but they are rampant.  Enemy design is awful, mechanically.  Enemies are either extremely boring to fight, or make me want to just uninstall the game.  Ranged enemies are often standing on the edge of something, so that you cannot jump up to them to fight them.  You have to dodge their projectiles while making a series of jumps to get to where you can jump toward them, attack from the air, and then fall and repeat that process.  They deal contact damage (an extremely dated mechanic that should have died a long time ago imo.) so you cannot just jump onto the same platform as them.  Repeated jumps, attack from air, fall, repeat.  It's tedious.  There is a spider enemy that is lightning fast in every direction, has the ability to lock you in place with a projectile that you cannot dodge while also being able to attack, and stays out of attack range unless you are locked down.  This makes them nearly impossible to hit while they harass you with high damage, high speed attacks, while there are other enemies around.  Scaling is also really bad.  Enemy damage nearly tripled from one area to the next, while they also gained a bunch of frustrating mechanics like the one mentioned.  It's not a gradual climb in difficulty that scales with your growing power.  Your power barely moves while enemies skyrocket.

It's worth mentioning here that player attacks aren't any kind of sophisticated thing.  You can attack in one direction, and jump, and have a nigh useless backstep.  Mechanical complexity for the enemy while you have NES era capabilities on the player character is not a fun mix.  

Player movement is well done, mostly, but the platforming in this game is honestly tedious because of level design and the insanely slow progression of the "metroidvania" aspect where you get new movement tech that allows you to reach new areas.  Larger platforming sections often come with tons of hazards and require pixel perfect jumps or you end up falling and having to start the section over.  The controls are fairly tight, but they are not tight enough for what's required to not be annoying.  Wall jumping gets especially tedious because the controls for this are done very differently from other games like this, and it feels pretty janky.  Sections that would be simple in a hundred other games like this turn into a massive chore because you're fighting the clumsy wall jumping controls while trying to remain perfect.  The controls for grabbing things mid jump are also very unresponsive.  

The game, on paper, looks like I should love it.  But every time I play it, I eventually hit spots that are frustrating, and not even close to in a good way.

review:
I would literally not say it is randomly generated.  I did 3 playthroughs and they were over 95% identical in room layout.  You will get the same equipment in the same order, follow the same path through the areas, fight the same enemies, and do it all with nearly the same items and almost exactly the same rooms you traverse.

So what's left is a pretty generic, alright Metroidvania.  My first playthrough I thought fairly highly of it- "oh the rooms are kind of samey but that's because it's randomly generated".  It is not randomly generated.  It is just generic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076361833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1109, 'last_played': 1667523297}
review:
Après 18h de jeu à vouloir faire à peu près tout je l'ai ENFIN fini.

Je vais être honnête, je suis un énorme fan des metroidvania surtout les Castlevania dont il est clairement inspiré d'ailleurs, que ce soit le bestiaire, l'HUD, les armes ou les sauvegardes. Malheureusement en terme de plaisir de jeu/exploration on en est loin.. peut-être est-ce son côté old-school voulu qui fait que le level design est aussi désagréable mais en tout cas c'est pas un point positif du tout.

Au fur et à mesure des niveaux les sauvegardes sont de plus en plus éloignées et si vous avez le malheur de mourir un peu trop souvent vous en aurez vite marre de refaire le chemin. Perso j'ai joué en difficile, même avec les meilleures armures on prend assez cher. La magie est anecdotique, les armes le sont aussi malheureusement donc on a pas le plaisir de tomber sur des armes ultra puissantes et rares.

Pour être honnête ce n'est pas un mauvais jeu mais il est pas incroyable non plus, tout juste moyen. L'histoire est classique mais suffisante, sauver un village et devenir un chevalier qui n'en a jamais rêvé ? La musique est sympatoche, le pixel-art est beau, les fights sont rigides mais jouables et les boss sont pour le coup des vrais boss, ça se first try pas aisément sans potions. Le jeu est court, comptez entre 7 et 15h selon la difficulté et votre niveau de jeu mais c'est bien pour ça que je le recommande, si vous le trouvez à bas prix c'est raisonnable mais pour son prix sinon vous serez forcément déçu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256161774', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 995, 'last_played': 1667342222}
review:
L'expérience de Chasm ne m'a pas envoûté plus que ça. Ce n'est pas un mauvais jeu, mais je l'ai trouvé plutôt rigide. Il se fonde sur des fonctionnements classiques, donc, il fait penser à d'autres jeux. Cela dit, la gestion du monde en procédurale et bien foutue. Le début est assez peinard, et en approchant de la fin, ça devient de plus en plus rogue-like.

Le pixel art est bien maîtrisé à mon avis, et j'ai trouvé l'univers assez beau. Il n'y a pas non plus une énorme variété d'environnements car le nombre de niveaux est restreint.

J'ai beaucoup aimé les musiques. Je les ai trouvées simples et efficaces, et même si elles ne sont pas nombreuses, jamais elles ne m'ont lassé.

Le gameplay ne m'a pas semblé extraordinaire. J'aime bien le côté exploration, mais les combats m'ont barbé par moment, du fait de la possibilité de ne frapper que devant soi, ce qui peut être assez lourd quand il faut vaincre un ennemi volant sur une plateforme minuscule. De plus, le personnage ne se retourne pas très bien, et parfois, je frappais d'un côté alors que je sautais de l'autre, et ça n'a pas toujours été pratique. Je n'ai fait qu'un seul run, et je me demande pourquoi on peut forger des armes en météorites (qui n'ont pas l'air d'être les meilleures) alors que je n'ai jamais mis la main sur le moindre lingot de cette fameuse météorite. Quand j'ai eu fini, il me manquait plusieurs choses à trouver, mais je n'ai pas eu le courage de retourner les chercher. Faut dire que le gap entre le dernier niveau et les précédents et quand même assez costaud, et ça m'a un peu saouler. Pour vaincre le boss final, je suis retourner au village, j'ai acheté plein de potions, et j'ai bourriné en restaurant ma santé quand il le fallait, donc j'ai trouvé ça un peu bidon.

Sinon, l'histoire est basique, mais c'est cohérent et bien amené.

Le jeu a bien tourné sous Windows 10, et à part ce bug de retournements qui ne marchent pas super, je n'ai rien remarqué de gênant.

C'est pas que ce soit un mauvais jeu, mais je préfère ne pas recommander Chasm car on peut largement s'en passer. Il n'y a pas de véritable défi (à part passer par moments certaines phases de plateformes avec des contrôles pas très précis, ce qui pour ma part, à tendance à m'irriter), et, le fait de ne pas vouloir chercher ce qui me manquait reflète le fait que je n'ai pas trouvé ce jeu très accrocheur.

Merci et bon jeu.

review: I am a 52 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing. I am a single father to my son, who is now 14. My son recently started playing and in less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me because it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching videos on Youtube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my son for help, and together we spent hours playing . I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my son since my wife had died. Steam has ever since brought me and my son closer again, and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both my son and I many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984180355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1271, 'last_played': 1662679838}
review:
This game has a lot to offer: 2 types of music to listen to, amazing graphics, a cool little story, and things you except from a metroidvania. And on the other hand it's not give you things you except from a metroidvania game. I found odd that the devs decided to put in randomization in level design instead of a well designed layout. It adds only frustration when you try to find some hidden place, and gives no advantages (only restarting the game randomize the layout anew). And this is not the only problem I encountered during my playthrough. The upgrade that gives you the ability to travel much faster is given to you very late in the game. There are a variety of weapons to use, but after getting the club, I never used any other weapon than the ones that give this overhead swing, it hits in a wide arc. You have to learn to time these attacks, but it was working for me best than anything else. Well I had a ton of problems with this game, but I also had aa ton of fun.
And this is why I recommend this game, it's no that hard, there are enjoyable parts, the graphics are really good, and I am very forgiving with games that let me progress and play it through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452557609', 'num_games_owned': 257, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1678714793}
review:
Eu tive uma relação de amor e ódio com esse jogo. por um lado ele tem um gráfico estilo pixel art muito bem feito ; boas musicas ; uma kralhada itens, armas e equipamentos ; tem diversos modos pra testa pós final do jogo , diversos inimigos diferentes, um mapa bem grande, tá traduzido PT-BR e por ai vai. 
   O problema é que esse jogo tem tantos problemas mas tantos que tornam ele um jogo completamente medíocre. pra começar, o diferencial desse jogo que é o sistema de seeds foi tão mal implementado que acabou virando mais um erro do que um diferencial pro jogo , o jogo é bem confuso e possivelmente você vai ter sua progressão interrompida graças a um pequeno detalhe , o dinheiro é exageradamente escasso , o jogo tem diversos itens porem apenas 25% é realmente útil , os inimigos tem um HP exageradamente alto , a historia é mais fraca que um anêmico que acabou de ser atropelad0 , e o combate se resumi a pular e atacar que nem um canguru porque se o personagem atacar quando esta chão o protagonista fica 13 anos preso na animação de ataque. 
    Chasm é um jogo mediano apesar dos erros ele ainda é um jogo que da pra se divertir, mesmo que seja um pouco massante , confuso ou até mesmo irritante. 
NOTA:  6,5

author: {'steamid': '76561198005374824', 'num_games_owned': 1051, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 957, 'last_played': 1663552154}
review:
I think I'm a sucker for Symphony of the Night style rpg/action/platformer type games.  I don't think Chasm is a great game by any means, but I enjoyed my time playing it.  

The biggest thing for me in this genre is feel.  Rogue Legacy 2 is a great example.  In that game, jumping and attacking feel awesome.  Chasm feels decent, but the weapons could be snappier, and there's this weird hitch on long jumps.  I think the game is trying to decide whether to attach you to a wall or not, but it definitely feels strange.

 There's also this random, what is supposed to be rogue-lite. element to the game, that I think Chasm suffers from.  Rather than spend time on a carefully curated experience, the developers implemented this randomization that shuffles around the dungeon every run.  That sounds great in theory, but keep in mind this is a Metroidvania, it isn't a run based game.  I just can't see the benefit of a random dungeon over one that is well designed. 

All in all, the game could be better, but I enjoyed it.  3 Stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040295426', 'num_games_owned': 625, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1663384620}
review:
Let me start praising the amazing polish of the game. The art is fantastic. 

It falls apart in the level design. It's quite uninteresting and boring, and also gigantic, which doesn't help at all. Drawn out corridors connected to another drawn out corridor, connected to a vertical shaft identical to the last one. Traversing the map almost puts me to sleep. 

Like many others have said, I blame the procedural generation. Combining metroidvania with procedural generated maps is a cool experiment, but one I recognize as not quite successful. There are no advantages to the procedural generation in this case, since you are unlikely to play the game more than once, but you do get all the disadvantages of it.

I really hope people read these negative reviews and still consider getting the game though. I think the devs are extremely competent, and I hate when some failed experiment penalizes them too much. Experimentation is the key to originality and not a lot of devs risk it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286893316', 'num_games_owned': 2663, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 791, 'last_played': 1662856759}
review:
Chasm - це гарний клон "SotN". Дуже багато елементів геймплея повністю скопійовані з "SotN" (не елементів метроїдванії).
Chasm, порівнюючи з "SotN", гра не така динамічна і трохи кидається в очі бюджетність арта, який звязаний з автогенерацією рівнів.
Але в цілому, гарна гра, приємно грать і зятягує досліджувати рівні гри. В грі гарна музика яка не встигає надоїсти за час проходження, але нажаль не така ориніналь що щось запамяталось.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008991843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1663026551}
review:
As a person who likes exploration games where you progress, level up and get some better gear. You know your general CASTLE + ALIEN PLANET stuff. It just feels inoffensive? I am putting a question mark there cause that is how i feel about it. Nothing is wrong with what is done, but the implementation just feels like luke warm water. The random map generation kept flipping my map sensor and I spent more time going down the RIGHT PATH instead of the dead ends where gear was. And it was a bit of a ughh when going back to find out that I could've saved time / pain by just not following my instinct?

Anyway, the controls are fine. They respond and definitely try to play SUPER safe of any tricks like backdash cancelling or whatever. But leave in the best normal of land cancelling attacks. So the game just has this kinda stiff feeling to it that isn't bad but I wish there was a bit of something more there. I was less worried about my damage number and more about how to just use the longest range option that wasn't horrible. 

At some point there was a grind for drops and it also just felt not great. At the heart of the game, there is something there its rough and probably went in some angles to try to be different. But what makes it different, doesn't make it shine. It kinda hurts it? I would recommend on a sale, or if you want to really experience it. It's just that I wouldn't be surprised if at the end you feel different than how you felt starting it.

review:
Está bastante bien. Los controles me pusieron bastante nervioso en alguna situación por culpa del delay que existe entre el ataque y moverse, pero el juego está hecho así a propósito, o sea que es una mecánica a aprender, si decides pegar de más, igual te calientan la boquita (aunque se pueden cancelar animaciones si presionas el salto a la vez que el ataque o el dash y el ataque pudiendo así evitar golpes). Quitando eso, el arte es muy bonito. A rasgos generales me encanto, es un buen metroidvania. Por sacarle alguna pega, creo que hay ciertas habilidades clasicas en un juego de este estilo como el doble salto por ejemplo, que a opinión personal (solo es eso, mi opinión, no digo que este mal) creo que tardan demasiado en dártela. Literalmente la obtienes al final del juego, entiendo que está hecho así y están todos los mapas orientados en que lo consigas al final, pero, lo eche en falta durante todo el gameplay. Igualmente, está muy bien y es muy entretenido! Me gustó mucho.

(no sé ni como ni xk pero me dieron el juego gratis en algún evento o algo de steam, bendesido x el de arriba)

author: {'steamid': '76561198992563884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 1305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1305, 'last_played': 1661808998}
review:
Chasm is a game that takes inspiration from games like Castlevania and Metroid. While I do believe the game does have a decent foundation there's just too many things I didn't like to be able to recommend it to others. The biggest issues being the gold gain vs cost, item drops, and level layouts. 

The largest and most glaringly obvious issue I had playing the game was the item drops. The average enemy kill count for me to obtain both drops was likely around 120-150 kills. The smallest being under 50 and most being over 300. Not only would farming for these items take a ton of time, there is also another rng factor on top of an item drop and that is rarity. Drops seemed to be based off of the luck stat which I averaged about 50 by the end of the game, but wasn't a stat that would really get boosted unless you got items or drops from enemies. As such I didn't get to start playing around with building my character until around the end of the 2nd dungeon, going into the 3rd. 

The second issue was the accumulation of gold. Lamps and enemies had a small chance to drop money either when destroyed or defeated. Often times however it would be a bag of 5 gold. This meant that the main income for gold was to be good at the slot machine that seemed mostly based on luck, or to sell equipment drops from enemies that the player doesn't use. The issue here being that most equipment drops come from farming enemies, so a player that doesn't want to sit and grind for 6-10 hours killing enemies for drops is going to find gold hard to come by. On top of this many enemies require multiple hits to kill even early on. With healing items once unlocked being expensive, this means the main way of healing comes from save rooms. However, these save rooms are often few and far between in maps. It should also be mentioned that enemies do not drop health orbs so the only ways of healing were either items such as food, potions, or save rooms. 

Which leads me to the level design. While the levels themselves weren't bad many of the rooms felt either needlessly big or simply just empty. It was also often in these rooms that I would find enemies standing at the corner or edge of a platform I needed to get to in order to progress making it difficult to not only kill them but from falling and having to go through the rooms platforms again. My first instance of this was in the mines when I needed to pull a lever but a rock orc was in my way throwing projectiles while I was trying to jump up onto the ledge. There were instances where I as a player didn't know where I was supposed to go as once you finish going through the keep you will then start backtracking to previous areas to use key items in rooms that aren't shown to be special rooms on maps, making progression after this point tedious to the player.

A couple more minor issues I had were systems like the roulette minigame that I found twice. This game could either grant the player a stat upgrade or a stat downgrade. Whatever you get being permanent. I found it not worth playing as there was simply too many slots to loose versus what you would gain. Another minor issue I had was magic. I assumed magic would be a spell, and to an extent they are. However, I didn't realize the magic was only purchasable and was things like magic (insert weapon name here) or magic shield. Because how to use magic isn't clearly explained I didn't have any viable magic I could use until late game, making the pool of mana I had absolutely useless. 

My final issue came from potions. Many of the shops you gain access to by saving villagers when exploring the many areas. One of these villagers sells potions. Upon rescuing her you may already have a recipe or two which she will take and make it a purchasable item from her. However, many of the potions, especially the better quality ones run for about 200 gold, a hefty price if you don't have much. On top of this a few chests require potions you will unlock later in the game, and one requiring you to go back to her just to purchase one that you just unlocked to then gain the final potion that's used only for one reason. Not only does collecting all the potions require a lot of backtracking it also requires the player to have all the artifacts. The most easily missed is the diving suit used only for a few locations in the garden and obtained by beating the arena. In my game the arena was a chore as there was no save room nearby that I could go to between attempts, and losing meant game over.

I want to like this game, and I think it has a lot of potential but in it's current state I just simply can't recommend it to others. Much of the rng that make up a lot of my problems could be fixed with a few tweaks. While some items are rarer than others it shouldn't take 30 minutes of grinding just to get a single rare drop. Other problems could simply be solved if the game had more direction for the player such as the issue I encountered with magic, and not realizing how it worked until late game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144958997', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 759, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1660640918}
review:
Игра оставила после себя смешанные чувства. С одной стороны мне было интересно играть, но с другой стороны хочется придраться ко многому. 
Самое неприятное - отсутствие сброса анимации атаки. Это серьёзно так мешает вам контролировать бой и это почти похоронило для меня двуручное оружие из-за долго анимации. Конечно оно полезно для атаки летающих противников, но лучше натренироваться использовать во всех битвах одноручное. У ножей радиус атаки слишком мал. О них можно просто забыть.
Иногда во время игры возникают такие моменты, когда ты банально не знаешь куда тебе идти. Один такой момент возник после убийства короля-лича, так как в тот момент я банально не знал куда мне идти дальше. Коридоры я практически все осмотрел, а что не осмотрел для меня были недоступны из-за отсутствия некоторых способностей. А скрипт для дальнейшего прохождения активировался в одном из ранее просмотренных мной коридоров. Откуда я мог знать? Без понятия. И я не знаю что в этом виновато: моё любопытство исследовать каждый тупик перед продвижением по сюжету, система генерации уровней или ещё чего.
Да и сами коридоры интереса не вызывают. Оформлено по простому и часто повторяются с малозначительными изменениями. Но зато с каждым новым прохождением пути у этих коридоров будут отличаться. Почти как в рогаликах, только тут одна генерация на всё ваше прохождение и сменится она после нажатия кнопки "новая игра". Это прикольно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032029345', 'num_games_owned': 3666, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 2369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2369, 'last_played': 1659038300}
review:
Ostatnio dość mocno eksploruję gatunek metroidvani, było więc kwestią czasu, aż trafię na jakąś hybrydę łączącą kilka gatunków. Chasm to własnie takie połączenie metroidvani, RPG oraz roguelite w jednym. Gatunki te, pomimo, że są różne, to doskonale potrafią się uzupełniać, o ile twórcy umiejętnie je połączą w jedną całość. W tej grze połączenie gatunkowe wyszło całkiem zgrabnie, ale twórcy popełnili jeden błąd, a mianowicie założyli, że w ich grę będą grać tylko inteligentni gracze. Czemu jest to błąd zapytacie? Ponieważ gry nie da się przejść bez samodzielnego myślenia, a losowo generowane rozwiązania zagadek, mocno utrudniają korzystanie z poradników i gotowych rozwiązań. Mi takie podejście pasuje, ale patrząc po dyskusjach na Steam oraz niektórych recenzjach, nie każdy zrozumiał założenia twórców, co wpływa na oceny tego bardzo dobrego miksu gatunkowego. 

Skoro już we wstępie zacząłem temat losowości, to pozwolę sobie wyjaśnić ten wątek do końca, aby czytelnik zrozumiał z jakiego typu grą ma do czynienia. Gra opiera się o ziarna, ma więc dość dużą, ale jednak skończoną ilość wariacji, a dodatkowo komnaty nazwijmy je główne, zawsze są w tym samym miejscu. Oznacza to, że mapa niezależnie od ziarna, będzie bardzo zbliżona, a główne zagadki zawsze są te same i zmienia się tylko rozwiązanie( aczkolwiek rozwiązanie zagadki i podpowiedzi nadal są w tym samym miejscu). Nie jest więc możliwym, aby wylosowało się ziarno w którym nie ma możliwości przejść dalej gry, bo zmieniają się tylko komnaty łączące komnaty główne. Konstrukcja gry wymusza na graczu powracanie do wcześniejszych lokacji celem zdobycia nowych zdolności, co pozwoli pokonać przeszkody w późniejszych etapach. Niestety gra niezbyt czytelnie komunikuje taką konieczność i zwyczajnie spora liczba graczy, potrafi się zaciąć i zrzuca to na losowość w grze, co oczywiście prawdą nie jest, bo schemat przechodzenia gry zawsze jest taki sam. ( grę przeszedłem 3 razy i za każdym razem schemat zdobywania zdolności był dokładnie taki sam, niezależnie od ziarna). Jak sobie uświadomimy ten fakt, to zrozumiemy, że gra jest losowa tylko w mocno ograniczonym stopniu, a ziarno wpływa tylko na komnaty łączące i pojawiające się tam przeszkody, przeciwników oraz skarby. Między bajki należy więc włożyć zarzuty graczy względem tego aspektu gry. Natomiast dla osób, które uważają, że wrogowie w późniejszych etapach są za trudni, gra oferuje możliwość zagrania na poziomie łatwym, który też testowałem w ramach osiągnięcia "mortal" i mogę śmiało zaświadczyć, że wtedy walka z bossami i potworami jest wręcz banalna.

W swojej konstrukcji gra jest typową metroidvanią ze wspomnianymi wyżej elementami losowości znanymi z gatunku roguelite. Przemierzamy więc świat stworzony w przyjemnej dla oka grafice piksel art 2D, skaczemy po platformach omijając przeszkody oraz walczymy z przeciwnikami, ale aby było ciekawiej twórcy dodali całkiem rozbudowany system RPG. Naszą postać określa szereg współczynników, które rosną wraz ze zdobywaniem przez nas wyższych poziomów doświadczenia. Jest dość klasycznie, aczkolwiek należny mieć na uwadze, że system ten jest raczej mało elastyczny i pomimo możliwości "rozwoju na magię", trudno nie zauważyć, że prawdziwych magów tutaj nie ma. Jedyną "magią" w grze jest broń rzucana, która zużywa manę, a bez której można się całkowicie obyć. Dodatkowo build postaci oparty jest głównie o ekwipunek, który wpływa na statystyki, więc pomimo zawartych w grze sklepów oraz mini craftingu u kowala ( raptem kilka rzeczy na krzyż), to w dużej mierze jesteśmy skazani na to co nam wypadnie ze skrzyń i potworów. Broni oraz różnej maści zbroi i hełmów w grze jest całkiem sporo jak na taką produkcję, więc takie podejście nie jest wadą, aczkolwiek warto mieć na uwadze, że ilość buildów z prawdziwego zdarzenia jest mocno ograniczona. Lepiej zdać się na los, który "wyekwipuje" nas po drodze do celu. W ramach ciekawostki można jeszcze dodać, że wyrzucane przez potwory przedmioty oraz te znajdowane w skrzyniach mają różne statystyki zależnie od stopnia rzadkości (zwykłe, magiczne oraz legendarne).  W grze dostępny jest też bestiariusz dzięki któremu możemy dowiedzieć się jaką broń, przedmiot lub zbroję można wydropić z danego mobka, co ułatwia "farmienie" konkretnych przedmiotów.

Gra Chasm przypadła mi mocno do gustu, a jedyne zarzuty jakie przychodzą mi do głowy, to średnio czytelna mapa oraz taka sobie muzyka bez polotu, a jedyny utwór który mi się od biedy podobał, to ten w katakumbach. Grę przeszedłem w całości grając na Steam Decku i brak opcji zbliżania mapy, mocno utrudniał orientację w grze na małym ekranie ( dobrze, że Steam Deck ma wbudowaną opcję lupy). Problem z czytelnością mapy występuje też na większych ekranach, tym bardziej nie rozumiem braku opcji przybliżania. Więcej grzechów nie pamiętam...

[h1]PODSUMOWANIE:[/h1]

Chasm to dobry miks gatunkowy z naciskiem na metroidvanię. Zarówno element RPG jak i losowość znana z gatunku roguelite, są tylko dodatkiem urozmaicającym rozgrywkę, a nie daniem głównym. Jeśli szukasz dobrej metroidvani, to własnie ją znalazłeś. W innym wypadku lepiej sobie daruj i szukaj dalej.

[b]PLUSY:
+ Ładny pixel art 2d
+ Ciekawe zagadki
+ Dobra konstrukcja świata
+ Elementy losowe 
+ Sporo broni i sprzętu
+ Projekt potworów i bossów

MINUSY:
- Taka sobie muzyka
- Średnio czytelna mapa
- Brak opcji zoom na mapie
- Magiem raczej nie pogramy[/b]

[h1]OCENA:
8/10[/h1]

[h1]**Ograne na Steam Decku**[/h1]
[b]Problemy: Mało czytelna mapa ( opcja lupy rozwiązuje ten problem częściowo)
Gra działa bez zarzutów i nigdy się nie wykrzaczyła na tym urządzeniu.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198015332538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1659265655}
review:
Прекрасная метроидвания с приятной пиксельной графикой и неплохой ненавязчивой музыкой в сопровождении.
Игровые механики вводятся постепенно и не успевают надоесть. Сложность боссов и противников на среднем уровне сложности умеренная, на более высоких сложностях простое лобовое закликивание приведёт к проблемам в прохождение, но упорство позволит пройти игру.
Платформинг не сложный, но с продвижением по сюжету приходиться подстраиваться к увеличению сложности препятствий, но даже так новички смогут справиться с этим испытанием.
Сюжет хоть и не хватает с неба звёзд, но не  вызывает отторжения.  Хотя вопросы возникают как те или иные НПС оказались в данной локации и как связанны эти локации и как можно было перейти в неё. Но если списать всё на игровую условность всё становиться просто и приятно.
В игре есть пара головоломок которые не столь столь сложны, но и не "Древние врата драконьих жрецов которые никто не может открыть хотя есть коготь с картинками"
Так же есть есть пара мини игр которые немного разбавляют геймплей, но и не заставляют сидеть в них часами

В целом игра приятная и позволяет отдохнуть играя в неё. И что самое важное в неё может спокойно играть человек ранее не игравший в метройды.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962035438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1658110862}
review:
I played on Steam Deck from beginning to end. I would not recommend a keyboard and mouse.

I will update this review if I continue to play and have more to add and will leave comments on.

PROS:
- The music and sound design were completely appropriate and fit the world.
- I really enjoyed exploring each new area thoroughly even if you don't need to. There's a lot of discovery here, and it's mostly worthwhile.
- The controls are tight and do exactly what you want when you want them to.
- Ran great the whole time.
- Excellent spritework.

CONS:
- Sometimes you'll get lost and have no idea what to do because signposting isn't super clear after a point. If you don't remember what you found two hours ago and where it was, you may be screwed into doing a ton of wandering. This made things drag on multiple occasions to the point where I had to consult the internet (which I think is a cardinal sin). Even then, the random nature of the game makes even this imprecise.

CONCLUSION:
All in all, one of the best metroidvania games I've played since the DS era Castlevania games or Bloodstained.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021442265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 782, 'last_played': 1657375570}
review:
It's OK (yet Steam won't let me rate it as such). I enjoyed parts of the game but others made me want to kick a puppy. I definitely wouldn't pay full price for it. There's clearly love in it though, and I'd try a sequel.

My biggest gripes are the obnoxious hitboxes, hurtboxes, contact damage and fact that your character needs a cooldown between each action. It's just not fluid. This is a shame because every single enemy is unique and encourages a dance of combat...except your movements just can't keep up and the environments are often too narrow to properly maneuver. By mid game, I was bunny-hopping everywhere, just because it increased swing speed and mobility. By endgame (especially the final area) I was skipping all combat and then tanking the last boss with an inventory full of healing items.

I understand it's a bit easier if you stack magic and spam throwing knives. Your mileage may vary.

[h1]The Good[/h1]
+Plenty of things to grind, like XP, upgrades, drops, cash, logs, secrets
+Proper metroidvania in terms of exploration and length
+Frequent hub areas for fast travel
+Enemy drops generally useful
+Rare versions of drops for higher stats
+Most enemies require a little bit of strategy
+Can swap gear to focus more on magic or melee
+All 80-some enemies are nearly unique with no recolors
+Colorful and well-animated
+Boss doors are marked, with saves nearby
+Multiple difficulties
+Arcade and Race modes of play for those that want a challenge

[h1]YMMV[/h1]
~Enemies never really drop health
~Health items can be stacked and used anytime to cheese bosses
~Very few iframes after being hit. You can get ping-ponged in a few spots.
~Could have benefited from some iframes when backdashing (like a dodge roll)
~Enemies aren't staggered by attacks and just keep charging you
~Occasional annoying platforming
~Music is ok. Nothing memorable, but nothing terrible.
~Bosses drop some OP gear if you manage to kill them without getting hit
~Some enemy drops are rather grindy
~Not much of a story or any kind of character development
~A few spots where the game gives little or no direction
~A few powerups that are only used in one or two spots

[h1]The Bad[/h1]
-Movement is stiff, with long cooldowns between actions
-Melee weapons are just too damn small and slow
-Enemy placement necessitates taking damage in many areas
-Enemy contact damage
-Difficulty rollercoasters a few times
-The order in which you obtain gear is baffling. Some pieces are vastly superior to others, and are obtainable early (not even including the boss drops).

review: Solid metroidvania, emphasis on the castlevania.  There are tons of weapon options that come in different quality/rarities, many of which drop sporadically from mobs. You'll want to do some grinding for XP (leveling up helps), crafting ingredients (sell nothing), and wearable equipment (beating a boss without getting hit makes them drop a special item, so being overprepared is good).  My only real gripes are that there are a few jumps off of vines that I was not good at, and the guides available will also tell you what monsters drop what, but not what movement abilities you get in what order or what zones you should look for them in.  I keep getting stuck/lost and having to explore, which handles the grinding.

review:

I waited a long time for this to come out and when I finally had it I was completely engrossed for days. Part of what makes it special is that this game was largely the work of one person.

If you like metroidvanias, you can't go wrong picking up Chasm.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050566062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1656297449}
review:
I read some of the bad reviews on here before purchasing this game, and 5 hours in I thought everyone was nuts and that Chasm was a masterpiece, but that impression changed the more I played. 

There are a lot of things I love about this game, and I was really enjoying my time with the first half of it, but I think as others have said what ultimately undoes it is the random world map. This isn't a roguelike where the caverns change every time you descend into them, it's a metroidvania with a set world that persist for the entire game (in my case an 11+ hour 'run' so far) - basing that world off of a random seed really does a disservice to what could have otherwise been an amazing game.

I really wish the random seeds (which I assume were added for replayability) were confined to new game+. As it is I found segments of my world generation were insanely hard to complete, with bosses at the end of long sequences of unusually high difficulty rooms set miles away from a save or travel point. There were times when I was forced to farm 'safe' enemies over and over in the middle of a journey to a boss just to try and heal from levelling up - which understandably became harder and harder to do the higher my level got. I will add I'm an experienced metroidvania and roguelike player - I don't think my perception of the random spikes in difficulty/grind come down to me being a bad gamer.

Sadly after many hours of enjoying myself, the generation of my world seed has turned the latter half of the game into an impossible grind fest that I just don't want to slog through anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005616069', 'num_games_owned': 854, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1540410348}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053345539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1656261844}
review:
Enjoyed this a lot. Controls are slick and combat feels nice, and the difficulty curve was really good too, went from being simple in the early areas to becoming quite a challenge towards the end, with some decently designed bosses - although more bosses with unique attack patterns would've been nice.

The main negative points seem to point out the amount of backtracking, and yes there is some, but it never really bothered me - fast travel points are generous enough that it's never too much of an issue, and some backtracking is to be expected from a game like this. 

Story is minimal but again I've always been much more interested in gameplay in games like these.

I'd definitely recommend if you like the Axiom Verge, Salt & Sanctuary etc brand of Metroidvania.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159428276', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1656114161}
review:
[h1] Chasm - E quando um Metroidvania dá errado? [/h1]

Chasm é o ótimo exemplo de quando o jogo tem uma ideia ótima, mas fica apenas na ideia mesmo. Aqui vou falar dos porquês que eu julgo que chasm é um jogo ruim.

Eles tentaram, mas tentaram muito mal fazer uma mecânica onde a história é linear, mas os mapas mudam de sala toda vez que você morre. O problema começa quando há apenas 3 ou 4  salas aleatórias e você acaba sempre caindo nas mesmas salas, fazendo o jogo parecer um ‘looping’ infinito dos mesmo mapas com os mesmos inimigos nos mesmo lugares. 

Falando nos inimigos, você fica até feliz de vê um inimigo diferente, até ele se repetir para sempre nas salas seguintes, quando você finalmente troca de área, inimigos novos aparecem, até eles serem só os mesmos na área inteira.

Os gráficos são bonitinhos disso não tenho do que reclamar.

A história? Fraca e descartável.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041457591', 'num_games_owned': 1625, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1654078086}
review:
Perhaps more than any other game, I'd rate this a "neutral" if possible. Truth is there is nothing wrong with it either on technological field, art, music, and so on. It's a metroidvania dungeon crawling game with some leveling up, a hub world, a fair storyline, and so on. Again: there is no problem with this game.

It's just: I've been playing platformers pretty much for decades now. I've had some great ones, interesting ones, bad ones, bland ones...and chasm is just so darn "middle of the road". There's simply nothing here I haven't seen equally good or better in other games. It doesn't have a hook, unique (or even uncommon) abilities or interesting storyline. It's just...standard in any way. Sorry...it's not this game, but me. But this review is equally how I feel about it...

author: {'steamid': '76561198005719768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1789, 'last_played': 1655543977}
review:
Tight control and enemy patterns makes combat feel good. In Chasm, enemies don't swarm you but ask that you carefully dispatch them by reading their attack patterns. If you made mistakes, you can only blame yourself. 

The procedural map generation is sort of Chasm's replayable point, but also its weakness. The generation is limited, due to having map progress being gated by essential items that grant you mobility abilities. Truly randomizing the map could have caused softlocks and break the game, which is why replays WILL feel the same with minimal difference.

Does it justify the cost? Maybe, wait for a little discount if it makes you feel better. It also takes minimum 3 replays to gain all achievements

author: {'steamid': '76561198052778576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 778, 'last_played': 1655163207}
review:
The game doesn't feel very good at start, but rest 2/3rd of the game were ok, mainly thanks to variety in enemy attack patterns and available weapons.

Downsides:

Controls aren't up to modern standards, they're not completely terrible but there are some annoyances - 
1. no attack buffering means you need to time your attack very well or they just don't happen and your DPS drops significantly
2. missing "coyote time" means you will miss important jumps from time to time
3. lack of leniency on jump height - sometimes you reeeeally gotta hold that jump button - or again, you miss your jump
4. problems turning around in-between attacks
5. You have more control mid-air than on the ground

Fetch quests - this is basically the only kind of quest you'll see, be ready to get reeeally familiar with the route back to the "base"

Music is alright but over my 13h playthrough it started to get very repetitive

Very weak knockback on attack made fighitng a bit annoying at start of the game, but on the other side having to respect enemy's ability to move probably made the combat more interesting for the rest of the game

Punishment for death is a bit too much (normal difficulty), you lose ALL progress since last save - including exploration and collectables.

And I wish there was a better stats comparison between items when you equip/buy/sell them, as well as ability to sort in some of the popups

--

Other than the listed downsides, the game was mostly a decent time for me, so I rate it 7/10 - grab it when on sale if you have an itch for metroidvanias

author: {'steamid': '76561198876511941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 689, 'last_played': 1653978940}
review:
Chasm é um jogo bem peculiar para mim, comprei chasm com as expectativas um pouco baixas por conta das diversas criticas, e de fato essas criticas estavam certas, inimigos e combate repetitivo; exploração que é totalmente banalizada se você conseguir o item do chefe ( matando o chefe sem levar hit ), eu literalmente peguei umas 30 armas diferentes, mas só usei 3 pois a cada arma nova que eu achava nos baus, ela era inferior a arma atual; salas quase iguais uma das outras, coisa que chato pra caralho e triste ao mesmo tempo, pois a pixelart do jogo é maravilhosa, mas pouco aproveitada; trilha sonora pouco inspirada, a unica que eu gostei foi a da  area da catacumba; inimigos esponja de dano, ou seja em toda area vc vai ter que dar varios hits para mata-los ( até nos inimigos mais fracos ); o fato dele não ter nenhuma novidade ou originalidade, algo que é meio decepcionante se você já jogou outros Metroidvanias; e mais algumas outras coisas que realmente decepcionam perante todo o investimento que esse jogo recebeu...
MAS.... por algum motivo, mesmo Chasm sendo o puro suco de um Metroidvania genérico com nenhuma inovação, mesmo eu já tendo jogado todos os Metroidvanias na serie Castlevania e mais alguns indies... Eu me diverti jogando Chasm, eu literalmente comprei o jogo e não parei de jogar por 8 horas seguidas, é muito dificil eu ficar tão focado em um jogo dessa maneira, eu realmente não sei por que ele me prendeu tanto.



#######################Conclusão Final#######################

Chasm é um muito genérico e mediocre perante oq ele poderia ter sido se tivesse usado todo o dinheiro arrecadado da forma certa, mas mesmo assim eu considero ele um jogo ótimo, eu realmente me diverti jogando ele, mas não consigo passar pano para todos os problemas que eu citei antes. Diversas pessoas irão ter experiencias diferentes por conta do Level Design aleatório estilo "Roguelike" dele, então basta você comprar e testar para ver se gosta ou não, pois gosto é relativo,
Só acho que 40 reais é bem caro pra Chasm... então eu aconselho que  faça como eu e compre na promoção.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970674841', 'num_games_owned': 2103, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 1673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1673, 'last_played': 1651895618}
review:
(7.5/10)

An interesting tweak on the Metroidvania Formula where a number of elements of the map are randomly seeded.  This unfortunately doesn't quite go far enough to make the game really fully replay-able as there are still all the same basic setups for each of the same basic areas, but it does mean that things remain structurally coherent and basically seamless in ways fully randomized games sometimes do not.

The underlying game is overall though quite decent, with solid bitmap style graphics and good sound/music.  The overall progression somewhat suffers a little from the randomization as you are never fully confident you find all the things in the right order and sometimes you can end up missing something without realizing it and needing to do significant back-tracking to determine just what that actually is. That also becomes an issue with several 'potions' you need to get recipes for to do single secret treasure rooms which feels a bit like an afterthought as most of those have basically no actual gameplay utility, and are only used to solve the one treasure/puzzle room they are needed for which can more often than not only actually get you one other thing to solve one other treasure room somewhere else.  

Despite suffering a little from that randomization it is still quite impressive how much of the game does remain solid to the point of feeling more like the areas were hand-crafted and that tech is quite impressive in the results on that front, it just feels a little under-utilized without more direct gameplay impacts or replay value.

In the end I do recommend it for anyone who does like Metroidvania style games, but don't be too ashamed to go peek at some walkthroughs to really figure out how some of the progression needs to work, as you are never going to be 100% confident if you are missing an in-game ability to progress, or whether you just missed something in an area you need to back-track to complete.

review:
Gallo Pinto Costarricense

Ingredientes
3 cucharadas de aceite de canola
1/4 cebolla picada
1/2 pimiento verde (o rojo) en cuadraditos
3 tazas de frijoles rojos o negros, cocidos
3 tazas de arroz blanco, cocido
1. pizca de Sal
2 cucharadas de culantro picado

Instrucciones
1. Calienta el aceite en una sartén grande y fríe la cebolla y el pimiento hasta que estén suaves.
2. Agrega los frijoles, bien escurridos, y fríe de tres a cinco minutos. Agrega un poco del caldo de cocción, si ves que están quedando muy secos.
3. Incorpora el arroz y sigue friendo unos tres minutos más agregando un poco más de caldo de frijoles para que el gallo pinto no quede muy seco y finalmente adorna con culantro picado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167172560', 'num_games_owned': 1202, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1619, 'last_played': 1650296965}
review:
全成就通关（初见hard+二周目easy一命），简单给点评价。

具体的玩法细节上我就不多说了，战斗部分做的打击感其实还不错，数值平衡也还行，重武器轻武器都有优劣之处，前者攻击范围广，后者攻击速度快，到了后期基础STR够高的情况下用小匕首不少时候dps比重武器还要高。

回血很难，没有metroidvania（类银河战士恶魔城）常见的掉回血道具的效果，高难度下同等级的敌人一下就是五分之一的血（easy差不多十分之一），开荒经常残血或者死非常累人。但是实际上boss难度不高，摸清了出招模式之后甚至可以打无伤（无伤过会有奖励boss武器，面板数值比同级别武器面板高而且攻击前摇后摇也短）。

地图设计是一大败笔，虽然宣传上号称添加了程序生成要素让每周目体验都有不同，但是实际上基本可以理解成“固定的重要大房间+连接的程序生成走廊”，实际体验并没有什么让人感觉能产生探索欲。重点在于metroidvania应有的分叉和迂回在chasm里非常少，整个地图基本就是线性跑路——碰到传送门回到传送间回血存档——继续线性跑路；除了少量剧情救人和一眼望到的奖励箱收集，能够游离在预设路线之外探索的就只有每个区域一个的隐藏门区域，玩家自由探索空间限死到几乎就差糊脸上警告“你只能走这一条路”。至于拿到新装备折返回到以前探索过的地方收集遗落道具和救人的时候，长距离的走廊跑路又会加剧游戏带来的枯燥感。

街机模式简单试了几局，感觉上就像去掉meta要素纯跑高分和速通的硬核版死亡细胞，把程序生成的随机要素不能说废物回收也只能说是有效活用。但是相比之下绝大多数roguelike都会在有限的选项中给予玩家一定自主配装、选择自己喜好或擅长的打法流派的空间（比如死亡细胞哈帝斯以撒），而chasm的街机模式……不能说裸装高玩，至少也是捡到啥就用啥，没得选。

可以说，chasm各方面许多元素都是建立在对恶魔城系列的致敬上，但是如果拿一个优秀metroidvania游戏的评判标准来评价chasm的话，只能说如果想玩一个比较有趣能留得住人的同类型游戏的话我恐怕更推荐公理边缘和Environmental Station Alpha。

author: {'steamid': '76561198090512021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 897, 'last_played': 1649208173}
review:
A competently made, but not particularly inspired entry into the metroidvania genre. This game's biggest hook is the randomization of the map, but the only way you'd get to enjoy that is if you play it more than once.

What you have here is an attempt to make a Castlevania game in the mold of Symphony of the Night and the games on the Game Boy Advance and Nintendo DS that followed its design. When it comes to the core gameplay, it mostly succeeds at reproducing what worked in those games. So much so that I found myself humming Castlevania music over the game's own, forgettable score as I played. The pixel art is nice if you're into that aesthetic, although I admit I spent way too long flip-flopping on leaving the CRT filter on or off. (Off, I decided.)

I am giving it a thumbs up because I don't think it would be fair to call it a bad game. I still had fun, I still finished it. I just don't think it would deserve to be a part of the conversation when it comes to the greatest titles of an already very crowded genre. People who want to play a metroidvania are already spoiled for choice, and there are much better choices to play than Chasm. It's not bad. It's mid.

Mehcommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561199250488949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1034, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1648993462}
review:
Wer ein simples und einsteigerfrendliches Metroidvania sucht, ist hier an der richtigen Adresse. Vor allem der Artstyle und das Gegnerdesign sowie die Animationen der meisten Charakteren ist mit viel Liebe gemacht und sehr augenfreundlich.

Für Veteranen des Genres ist das Spiel ein bisschen zu monoton, da hier nicht viel neues geboten wird und in Sachen Nebenquests und dem Crafting-System nur halt das Nötigste gemacht wurde um anwesend zu sein.

Alles in allem hat mir das Spiel gefallen, auch wenn es an machen Stellen langweilig war. Werde es in Zukunft nochmal spielen, wobei die Random-Generation der Map nicht die entscheidene Rolle spielt. Hätte mich eigentlich mehr um eine feste Map mit mehr Details gefreut. Naja
 
6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198208299437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1648808108}
review:
- Traditional castlevania-leaning metroidvania.
- Apparently some of the layout is procedurally generated, but honestly for me that was not much of a bonus, it doesn't seem very replayable.
- The graphics were very nice, atmospheric and detailed. I liked the different animations for different classes of weapons. I would have liked to have seen the armour my dude was wearing on his sprite though.
- Sound design and music was good. Some of the tracks were very atmospheric and well put together. Some of the intrumentation was a little retro-sounding, which seemed to be on purpose. Very characterful.

- The upgrades/abilities were not very inspired at all, with literally half the upgrades being basically wall-jump upgrade stages: grab certain parts of walls/ledges, jump off two walls, jump off one wall.
- Movement upgrades didn't feel nice to use. The wall jump was finicky and un-fluid.
- Bosses were significantly less challenging than normal enemies due to inbalanced amounts of health.
- The backstep was practically useless since the telegraphs were so late compared to the speed of controlling your character. You end up just learning the rhythm of enemies if you need to fight a lot of them.

Overall, I'd reccomend if you're really jonesing for a metroidvania and you played all the good ones.

This game is very mediocre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297975045', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1726, 'last_played': 1647882359}
review:
Chasm!
Confesso que esperava mais dele, ele não revoluciona em nada e absolutamente nada do jogo é impressionante, ( jogabilidade questionável, ost pouca imersiva, enredo fraquíssimo, etc.. ) não espere inovação, não chega a ser ruim é claro, posso dizer que em todos os quesitos o jogo é bem mediano e linear, pouco desafiador a ponto de não morrer uma única vez no modo normal que é recomendado pelo game, combate e level design meio repetitivo,  itens e armas não muito variados e mal aproveitados, apesar de tudo,  até que foi gostosinho de jogar pq gosto mt desse estilo de jogo e me dei o trabalho de platinar rsrs... Único ponto forte que vale a pena ressaltar é a pixel art e alguns puzzlers do jogo. Fora tudo isso não tem nenhum diferencial que faça o jogo ser único!
O que mais me incomodou foi o game com financiamento concluído em 12 de maio de 2013 e previsão para lançamento inicial em 2014 e lançado em 31 de julho de 2018. Todo esse tempo de desenvolvimento e acabar sendo ofuscado dessa maneira, comprei ansioso pela semelhança ao SoN, vai por mim, passa longe, bem longe msm rsrs...
Apesar de seus erros Chasm ainda é um jogo divertido e uma experiencia interessante sendo uma fácil recomendação.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080493208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1172, 'last_played': 1627268495}
review:
I love Metroidvanias and sometimes I'll venture off the beaten path to see if I find something interesting and different in the genre. In that quest, I played a game called Chasm. You begin as a novice knight in a kingdom and are tasked with traveling to a hamlet called Karthas, a village that has been beset with some tragedy. There are a number of locals who have disappeared within the town's mines, and it is your job to recover them, discover the cause and save the day. Without going into the whole story, there is more to the mission than first appears, and in the course of rescuing the denizens of this place, you will uncover a deeper, darker, ancient mystery (of course, lol). The narrative is presented via documents that you find and text-based interactions with the villagers. I found it fairly intriguing, but it certainly wasn't the main reason I remained engaged.

The structure of the game is a procedurally generated series of underground maps. The layout is randomized, albeit with pre-formed rooms. There is still the familiar metroidvania pattern of unlocking new skills and tools to progress to previously unreachable areas, so if you only play it once, you'd never know that there is any element of variability to the appearance of the maps. There was a very nice sense of being rewarded when discovering a new artifact or tool that enabled you to parachute, climb, double-jump or maneuver yourself into previously inaccessible regions. So exploration was consistently engaging with only some typical, but moderate, frustration when you didn't know where to go next. There were some rpg elements in the form of magical weapons, leveling, RNG drops including rare items, crafting, gear, healing and buff items, and so on. There were plenty of options to make your character and his abilities fairly unique. There were also side-quests that the rescued villagers doled out that, if completed, rewarded you with some additional benefits.

In terms of the mechanics themselves, everything controlled very tightly. Things were smooth, very responsive and fun in a moment-to-moment sense, and it made learning the patterns of the game's many enemies all the more satisfying as I wasn't fighting with poor input. There were a variety of bosses, including a pretty tough final boss, and they were - along with the many normal baddies - designed well and had an interesting appearance for the most part. Speaking of appearances, the overall look of things was quite nice. The different maps were varied, from jungles and caves to lava and otherworldly locales. The map feature was as Castlevania as can be with the square rooms everywhere, and viewing any map could make you think you were playing a Castlevania game. I also really appreciated the ability to mark rooms that may have had something interesting, but inaccessible so that I didn't have to guess where I wanted to return later on.

On the down side, this was obviously made by a smaller developer, and it shows in the sense that it's missing some of that special sauce in terms of presentation you would expect from a game that was developed with more funds and resources. It's got its own personality, but it's just clearly a work of a more modest budget, which is fine, but sometimes you miss the glitz. But in the bigger picture, I have to acknowledge that it was hard to put down once I started. I played close to 20 hours to complete things, including some side-quests/extras, and I did it all in a pretty short span, so there is no doubt that it kept me engaged all the way through. It's not a classic in the genre, but I don't regret playing it at all, and can certainly recommend it to anyone who considers themselves a fan of the genre. 4/5.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993778444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1647776125}
review:
I'm gonna start by summing up why I would not recommend this game: tedious.

Every aspect of the game feels like a chore rather than a fun challenge. Every game design decision feels like it is made to just make the player's life a tedious grind rather than a fun exploration RPG.

Here's more details on why I felt that way.



Level design

The  platforming in this game is incredibly tight. Most of the actions you're required to do to progress have very little leeway. Rooms are littered with mostly small platforms that quickly just become 1 character-length blocks as you progress.
And when you think it can't be worse, the game adds more obstacles because, for some reason, it felt like it was still too fun.

Of course, around those small plaftorms are traps and other mecanics like crumbling or timed platforms that will make it even harder not to fall.
You will eventually get an upgrade allowing you to grab on ledges, but not all platforms are eligible
Also you'd better not want to do any other action, like attacking, during that jump because you cannot attack and grab in the same leap (unlike most other games of the genra.)

But if you fail you'll just have to try again right ?
Yeah, but you'll also pretty much always take damage because the floor is lava in most of the rooms.

Of course, a fair number of rooms are also designed in a way where if you fall, you have to redo the whole room from the start without any single mistake.

Coupled with the constantly tight platforming and traps that will undoubtedly make you fall relatively often, the level design and platforming is tedious.


But can it be that bad to take damage and retry when you have an RPG system to heal and become stronger ?
Why yes, it can.



RPG & Combat

Stronger is not the word I would use to describe the combat progression in this game.
Levelling is grindy from the start. And while it does provide a much needed full heal on level up, one will find out that you do not gain level often enough that it will actually save them much.

Levelling up also feels underwhelming. You don't get much stats and/or it doesn't seem to make your combat abilities that much stronger. 
At some point I even cheated to get from level 19 to level 49 and saw that my damage had gotten from 40 to 57 with the same weapon.
And while I would accept some grind to get there, I did cheat for one reason: XP given by mobs decrease with each level you gain. 
So to attain that level 49, which was around 100 000xp when I was at less than 10 000, I would have had to defeat around 80 000 enemies since they would have started to each give me 1xp per kill by the time I had gained a few levels.

Levelling is tedious, and the rewards do not justify the investment.


And then there's combat.
Your character doesn't feel like a brick, but they do not feel nimble either.
If you're not constantly jumping while attacking, you'll get hit because of the delay at the end of your attacks.
There is no backdash cancel, so most of the time it you timed your attack wrong you're done. No way for you to avoid damage.
You also have to constantly keep close to mobs if you actually want to hit. No matter what your weapon is, your range is very limited and mobs will have better range than you most often that not.

Basically you have to git gud pretty fast, otherwise combat will be you attacking the air while mobs bash you from a safe distance.
Also their AI is better than you. They know their perfect distance of attack and use it constantly.

On another note they also have a tendancy to stay on the side of the platforms you wanna go to, so that you'll either abort your jump or take recoil damage from them when platforming.
Of course, you'll end up in the pit of instant DOT damage whenever that happens.

Back on combat a fair number of mobs are either faster than you or have ranged attacks, making them even more of a bother with your very limited range and not so nimble movements.

As for you, you have one ranged option: magic. However, magic is a misnamer because it's actually just throwable items that consume mana, and it's not mana but actually ammunitions.
Basically it's not mana: it's the heart system from castlevania games. It throws some manner of distance weapon that consume a fixed number of "mana" point, that you can ony recover from drops on mobs or breakable lights. No "mana" regen there: it's just ammunition-based.
So yeah, you have a relatively limited amount of distancee options, and the drop-rate is too low to make it worth it. Also you don't get a free refill when you level up, unlike HP.

And that's it for your combat capabilities. You're pretty limited while mobs can outrange and outspeed you constantly. So you keep taking damage all the time unless you play like a god.

I forgot to mention that mobs and traps hit for usually around 5~10% of your HP. So 20 "mistakes" (or unfair platforming moments, or mobs that outspeed and outrange you) and you're dead.

Of course, there is no option to regen your HP that would sufficiently balance out these losses. You have three possibilities:
-Drop from mobs
-Brought potions
-Save points

Mobs don't drop health items often enough, and obviously if you're already struggling to keep your HPs fighting mobs is not really a viable option.

Potions cost money, and they're not available until you rescued the NPC that sells them. Money is still a drop by the way, but at least you can get it from breakable objects... at a low rate. So it's super grindy and makes the game even more tedious.

Save points will heal you completely, if you can make it back to one before you die. Most of the time you can, of course. However, it's not fun to have to constantly run back to one as the most valid option to get health back. No fun to be found there.


I could go around and describe more of the game, but I've already described the core of any game: its gameplay. And this one feels like a chore to play.

There is a reason why, as I discovered earlier, only 1/4 of players got to the 3rd boss and beat it (the achievement Titan says 24.6% of players did the job)


As such I cannot recommend this game. It is clearly not what I wish to play.

If you're into a challenge, you might find something you like there since the game is indeed challenging. Otherwise, there are other metroidvania games out there that will give you a better experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255716450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1605, 'last_played': 1642642796}
review:
26시간 정도 플레이를 하고 느낀 건. 딱. 고전 스타일 게임을 즐길 수 있다면 재밌지만, 아니라면 영...

백대시는 있지만, 이동용으로나 쓰던 악마성 월하 때에 더 가깝고 간단하게 캔슬이 되는 것도 아닌데다 공격 도중에 취소가 되는 것도 아니어서 쓰다 맞기 쉽습니다. 일러스트에선 방패를 들고 있길래 방패를 통한 액션을 기대 했지만, 그런 건 없더군요. 전투에는 도움이 별로 되지 않는 백대시가 아니라 방패를 들고 방어하고 치는 것이 게임의 움직임에 더 잘맞았을텐데...

장비 몇가지는 고정된 스팩으로 나오나 대다수의 장비는 몬스터 처치시 드랍되는 장비들로 

이 장비들은 어느정도 정해진 범위 내에서 무작위로 능력치가 달라지기 때문에 레어,에픽,레전드로 나뉘어도 레어가 레전드 보다 나을 때도 있고 레전드가 나와도 능력치가 별로면 또 파밍을 해야하는데 일반적인 진행으로는 도저히 만족할만한 스팩의 장비가 쉽게 나오질 않아 긴시간 노가다를 하던지 해야 겨우 얻을까 말까 ?

한번 행운을 엄청 높여서 테스트를 해보니 100 LCK 전후를 기준으로 드랍율이 엄청 좋아지기는 하지만, 2개 드랍 하는 몬스터가 1개만 내놓질 않나... 파밍에 있어서도 그리 좋지는 않았습니다.

게다가 캐릭터의 크기가 작으면서 무기들을 활용하기 쉬운 게 아닌 것이 대형 무기들은 사거리가 간신히 길이가 나와주지만, 딜레이 때문에 치다가 맞기 쉽고. 결국 롱소드 계열이나 채찍계만 쓰게 됩니다. 가장 짧은 주먹 너클계열과 단검 계열 무기들은 공격 속도는 분명 빠르나 경직은 먹어주질 않는 몬스터와 보스의 특성상 접근전에 대한 부담이 훨씬 더 크고

성장도 초반에는 죽기가 쉬운 것이 겹쳐서 무기는 무조건 일정 이상의 길이가 있어야 안정적이라. 창과 채찍이 가장 좋더군요. 그러나 극초반에 이 두 무기들 중 하나라도 나오면 잘 풀릴 수 있으나 아니라면...영;

레벨업을 한다고 능력치가 충분한 폭으로 많이 올라가지도 않는데 게임 내에서 유의미할 정도의 능력치 상승은 정상적으로는 무리였습니다. 능력치가 오르는 스크롤은 몇개 얻지도 못하는데 많이 나오지도 않고 그나마도 무작위로 올라가기 때문에 티가 나지도 않지요. 여러 부분에서 보강하고 다듬어 줬었다면 더 나은 게임이 되었을텐데 그 때문에 평가를 높이 주기는 힘듭니다.

맵 전반에 있어서도 어느정도 무작위로 바뀌는 부분이 있어서 반복 플레이를 어느정도 힘들지 않게 해주기는 하지만, 세이브 장소에 대한 문제가 좀 있고 귀환 스크롤 아이템은 무제한 구매가 불가능해서 정말 피치못할 때 빨리 저장을 해야하는 상황을 대비한 경우에만 쓸까말까 합니다.

돈을 모으는 것도 쉽지가 않은데 비해 단검 투척이나 수리검 투척. 성수(악마성 스러운) 같은 것을 투척 하는 것도 골드를 통해 구입하고 보석으로 3레벨 까지 강화할 수 있으나 다시 플레이를 하려니 클래스를 고를 수 있길래 대충 해보니 마법사로 하지 않는 이상. 소모되는 MP를 쉽게 채울 수 없더군요. 물약을 사면 채울 수는 있지만, 그 물약 구할 돈이 엄청 짜게 나와서 쓴다면 결국 보스전이나 강적 상대로나 쓰게 됩니다. 

기본 직업 기사가 아닌 전사로 플레이를 하면 아예 거의 사용할 MP가 없고 인트 성장율도 매우 낮습니다. 말 그대로 몸으로 떼워야만 하는데 그게 참 어렵고 직업에 따른 벨런스도 그리 좋지는 않더군요. 마법사는 초반 HP등이 너무 낮고 회복 물약도 구할 수 없는 극초반에는 사로잡힌 인질들 중 술집에서 포션을 만들어주는 NPC를 구출하기 전까지 진행이 너무나 힘들었습니다.

회복 아이템도 참... 어이가 없는게 포션은 무제한으로 구입할 수 있지만, 단숨에 많이 구할 수 없었습니다. 보통 방향키를 누르고 있으면 자동으로 몇개 구입할지 카운트가 올라가지만, 그런 건 없었죠.

게다가 정상적인 플레이로는 돈이 무척 쪼들려서 넉넉하게 사는 것이 후반 가서도 힘들어서 플레이는 조심스러울 수 밖에 없습니다. 무슨 특별난 액션이 있고 진행 중에 임시로 HP를 회복할 여지가 적당히 있지도 않습니다. HP랑 MP를 채워주는 샘 비슷한 건 마을이나 투기장에서나 볼 수 있는 편이고 투기장에선 바로바로 채워지지도 않았죠.

요리도 있기는 하나 서너개 정도를 특정 아이템을 구했을 때나 가능한 식이라 이 또한 존재의의를 알 수 없었습니다. 회복량도 별 많지도 않은 편이죠.

숨겨진 아이템을 구하려면 투명한 것을 인식할 수 있게 해주는 포션 제조법과 시간 정지 물약이 필수인데 이런 레시피들은 꼼꼼히 게임을 플레이 하지 않으면 모르고 지나쳐버리는 경우도 생길 수 있고...

일부의 무기는 고유한 강점을 가지고 있거나 특수한 고유기능이 있기는 하지만, 그게 썩 쓸모가 있을 정도는 아니어서 기를 쓰고 구하기도 좀 미묘합니다.

추천은 하지만, 어디까지나 복잡하지 않은 액션성을 바탕으로 고전 게임 즐기듯이 저가로 즐기고 싶다면 해볼 여지가 있는 정도입니다. 고유한 재미가 너무 없습니다. 슬라이딩과 매달리기 천천히 낙하.(보따리로...) 딱 그 정도 액션이 끝이라 액션성은 거의 없습니다.

방패를 구현하여 막는 것도 적과 방패 성능이나 능력치에 따라 밀려나는 정도가 다르게 하고 막고 난 다음. 혹은 막으면서 치거나 베기. 찌르기로 처리를 한다던가 하는 식으로 무기를 더 역동적으로 쓰는 액션에 공격을 취소하고 몸을 빠르게 내빼는 동작의 구현. 

무기의 종류 마다 액션을 추가로 조금 더 제대로 구현을 시켜서 액션성을 확보 해주었다면... 더 좋은 평가를 받을 여지가 있겠으나. 움직임이 답답할 정도로 정직한데 비해 반응이 느린 유저는 전투를 쉽게 진행할 수 없을 때가 많았습니다.

공격과 방어를 즐길만한 기본 시스템이 잘 갖춰진 것도 아니고 회복 물약빨로 밀어붙이는 것도 힘들고 후반가면 적과 싸우기 보다 그냥 피해다니는 게 좋더군요...

고전 게임의 불합리하고 부족한 면모를 지금도 감당하실 수 있다면. 세일 때 해볼만하나 아니라면 좀 그렇습니다. 어느정도의 스토리도 있기는 하지만, 영어를 몰라도 전개가 뻔히 보일 정도로 평면적입니다. 게임이 재밌었다면 상관 없었을 문제지만, 부족해서 더욱 모자르게 느껴지는 아쉬움이 있군요.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967997881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1645125749}
review:
I'm sad to say that I cannot recommend this game. This is actually a bad game in my opinion. Lets look at the pros and cons though:

Pro: 
- an excellent pixel artist designed this and the graphics are beautifully drawn (maybe the only selling point of this game)
- The menus and options are well coded, look nice and are easy to use and understand
- There are many different languages you can play this game in

Neutral points:
- the gameplay is solid but also very simple. It gets old very soon. 

Con:
- the music is annoying. You feel like turning off the sound because of it. 
- It feels like you're doing the same thing over and over again with no feeling of accomplishment
- I only played this for an hour but I felt really bored from the repetetive nature of everything. 
- There was no way to speed up the character (maybe it comes later in the game) but it felt exhausting to run around like that for so long
- the game overall seemed to lack originality. 

Very sad to not recommend this even though the graphics are so nicely done. I finally died because of boredom: I kept playing more and more recklessly to make things more interesting. When I died I didnt feel like ever turning it on again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360963560', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1652898298}
review:
绷不住了，我也算是玩过很多类恶魔城了，还是第一次玩到这么怪异又无聊的，好的不学坏的全学到了！

剧情平淡如水：下矿洞救人，世界观都没交待清楚就通关了，神秘部落也是非常神秘，根本不知道在讲啥；
再就是存档问题：不支持自动存档（甚至打完Boss或者精英怪都不自动存），死亡只能读最近一次的手动存档，如果不小心退出了就只能重跑重打，存档点一般是途中一个，Boss房前一个，要么就传回第一张图存档，存完再传回来重新跑一遍图；而且只能通过存档点/升级和食物回血，食物也很贵且难掉落；
三是BOSS和小怪的碰撞伤害和技能伤害是一样高的，加上存档和回血很困难，这就使得BOSS战很简单而跑图容错率非常低，死亡挫败感很强；
四是手感，跳跃手感真的稀烂，钩爪判定很迷，还偏偏那么多地形杀跳跳乐，空中碰撞是憨憨硬直掉落；动作手感我就说一点，就是后撤的优先级低于平A，那你整个后撤有啥用，还不如跳跃灵活，要么你就把怪物的动作AI改笨重，不然主角笨重怪物灵活，不伦不类的；
五是道具装备真的太少了，你剧情和动作系统都这么拉了，麻烦就整多点收集要素，加强获得装备得成就感啊，抱歉，一点成就感都没有，因为只有竞技场掉的角斗剑能用。

唯一的两个亮点是：
1.BOSS设计得还不错，无伤还有额外奖励。
2.主线解谜任务道具是随机生成的。
（建议你再做续作直接做成茶杯头那样的街机得了）

不说了，就当是挂卡游戏吧，它卡还挺多的，哈哈
