author: {'steamid': '76561198072397483', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1367, 'last_played': 1607626211}
review:
Un juego bastante divertido. Tiene serios problemas luego de que pasas los dos primeros niveles. 

La jugabilidad es fluida y divertida, pero te hace volver por donde viniste muchisimas veces e incluso de forma artificial. En los niveles finales del juego, directamente el fuerte (que es el penultimo nive) tiene un diseno horroso que no invita a seguir en el, solo quieres ir hasta el boss y salir de ahi. 

La progresion de niveles y el daño que te hacen los enemigos esta un poco desbalanceado, y eso se acrecenta en la recta final, que puedes tener estadisticas altisimas y los enemigos te quitan entre 20 y 25 de vida con cada golpe (teniendo 200 de vida si farmeaste mucho durante el juego). 

Un juego recomendando para aquellos que quieran un juego simple, que represente un reto, pero no sea estresante de ninguna forma.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070284801', 'num_games_owned': 845, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1522, 'last_played': 1607512605}
review:
A pretty little Metroidvania that is marred by many small annoyances that keep it from being truly good. I did my initial playthrough on hard and got my ass kicked frequently. Income wasn't very reliable and consumables were expensive. But that all added to the satisfaction of playing well in a long trek towards a save point or in a boss fight. The controls feel reliable and accurate which is vital in a tough game like this. I was impressed with how tangible my improvement was. When finding a new enemy I would pretty much always be in danger of dying but after a few encounters I could reliably kill them without getting hit.

The presentation is where this game shines. The music feels very nostalgic and has a nice variety in tone that's fitting for the different levels. The art is also gorgeous. The enemies and bosses have very detailed spites and are instantly recognizable. But especially the animation is top notch which is important for reliably reading attack patterns. I liked flicking through the bestiary to see the big baddies that I'd overcome. Unfortunately there's no flavor text for the enemies and the story is pretty forgettable too.  

There's a lot of different genre elements thrown in here. A bit of RPG, a bit of procedural generation and some random loot drops but those don't enhance the experience. I think this game would've been better if the devs held more control over the power curve and level design. It happened quite frequently that I would backtrack to open a chest and get something useless while I would get a great drop from a random enemy. It's nothing gamebreaking but it just feels bad. 

Then there is the navigation issues. While the map is functional, it doesn't show why a path is blocked and you can't place useful markers so you'll be completely reliant on memory when backtracking. It's also hard to read. For the 100% map achievement I spent ages staring at the map to find the last area to explore. Then there is the stupid travel system where you'll waste a ton of time going into the wrong door or having to go to the single save point. And while I think the enemy design is good you'll encounter really unfair situation. Enemies might be edge-guarding forcing you to reload an area or tank hits. And playing optimally means simply jumping over everything and not interacting at all, 

With all that said, I 100% it and had a decent time while playing so it gets a small recommendation. But with so many excellent Metroidvanias on steam it's on the bottom end of the list.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111537375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1010, 'last_played': 1634414624}
review:
It's a good game. But it's not as good as it's predecessors; Symphony of the Night and Super Metroid. It's also not as good as it's contemporaries, such as Hollow Knight or Blasphemous.
It's main gimmick is that the dungeons are procedurally generated; for randomized playthroughs and speed running. The downside is that the dungeons are kind mediocre, and the game is much smaller than any of the previous mentioned games, so I don't really have the desire to play through multiple times. Feels like a movie studio that tries to launch a cinematic universe instead of making a really good movie. It would have been better to get one really good game, than an infinite number of "meh" ones.
Still, I suggest it, when you see it on sale.                               6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198321552794', 'num_games_owned': 10412, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1624456921}
review:
CHASM这游戏我在PSV上玩过，一直挺喜欢的。

但是汉化版本没更新，后续的很多内容没有。

我去年做过一部分汉化，但是因为字库原因，所以最后是搁置了。

上周看到贴吧有老哥更新了PSV的新版本，所以我就拿着试了。

确实改观了不少，一些明显的排版问题都有了修复。

不过还是有不少问题，但是至少有新版本的字库了。

所以借助前人的努力，得以完成这次的汉化。

同时还要感谢，帮我排除了很多问题。

不含坛友测试，我这次总共花费时长应该是在40小时左右。

致谢列表：
游侠汉化组，为游戏主文本，食品，成就，界面做出了最基本的翻译。定义了整体基调。
imjinjia，对游戏主文本进行了一些修正翻译，还有重新排版，使整体可读性提高。
Murphy，万狐飞仙及其他进行测试的坛友，多亏了坛友，这次汉化的排错进度很快。
特别是Murphy坛友，这次汉化中的怪物名称和他探讨了不少，怪物名称有他一份工。

那么，写了这么多，该说下我做了什么（仅含有争议部分）：
1.虽然imjianjia做了不少工作，但是排版，翻译方面还有问题的。
经过坛友反馈，及我的修正，重新排版了不少内容，并一些对语句进行了修改，重翻等。
2.界面在游侠基础上，重新进行了修改，增补等。
4.对食品进行重新翻译，修正及排版。
5.对成就的描述及关键词进行了重新翻译。
6.物品翻译部分借鉴了imjianjia的，其余的是我做的。
7.怪物翻译，
筋肉人->灵感来自Murphy的肉人，原本我是叫的屠夫。
山怪->原文是Troll，受惯性思维，我以为是巨魔，所以改叫哥布林，但是坛友帮我纠正了这个问题。
鬼工->昨天晚上提到的，原本我们是叫鬼矿工的，但是发现貌似不是那样，先前想当然了。
爬虫->原本是叫刺兽，因为我一直以为是刺猬，但是其原词Crawler组合Internet其实是网络爬虫的意思，因此叫做爬虫。
行走植物->原本我是叫步行植物，但是Murphy指明这个可能不太贴切，想了想，确实是的。
血生怪->其实是叫血衍怪的，但是差字，所以退而求其次了。
猩怪->原本是音译，但是后来发现用外形比较贴切。
活化盔甲->原本是活体，但是和坛友讨论后，发现了我的疏忽，活体更像是其有肉，但是实际上是没有的。
不死矛兵->原文是Lancer，我因为汉化过老滚的MOD，所以一直用枪骑翻译，但实际用的多的是长枪，也是坛友提醒我才发现。所以最后定的是矛，因为字库无枪这个字。
女巫->原本我是翻译巫师，因为游戏Witcher简中翻译是巫师，在长时间熏陶下，我就把Witch当做了巫师，但其实这个是女巫的专有词，得亏坛友提醒了我。
格纳洛克斯->多亏坛友提醒，我反应过来这个在主文本其实有翻译。

视频预览：
https ://www. bilibili. com/video/BV1tK4y1f7f4

汉化包含PC及PSV，PSV需要Repatch插件：
https ://pan .baidu. com/s/1XwhY5sCZOd72akoTg2Y8_w
提取码: xtut

如果你觉得有帮助，欢迎帮我的评测点个赞，谢谢.

review:
It'll Scratch An Itch... For A Little While

It's your run-of-the-mill Metroidvania with nothing new or groundbreaking to make it stand out. 

Pros:
 + Fun Metroidvania platformer
 + umm..

Cons:
 - Ridiculously difficult boss fights
 - Ridiculous "Die and it's Game Over, sorry you didn't save" mechanic
 - Ridiculously ineffective Gold and EXP grinding
 - Ridiculously overpriced shop items that take a ridiculous amount of time to farm gold to purchase

Maybe it's just me, but even though I really enjoy the exploration and adventuring aspects of the game, all the fun comes to a screeching halt when I can't beat a boss and can neither effectively grind for exp nor farm gold well enough to purchase and upgrade magic attacks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031617164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 239, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1606478624}
review:
캐즘

2D 사이드뷰 픽셀그래픽 메트로베니아 RPG 게임.
몬스터가 우글거리는 광산에 붙잡힌 마을 주민들을 구출해내는 기사의 이야기를 다룬다.

보통 난이도로 플레이 했는데, 초반에는 상당히 불만족스러웠다.
첫 번째는 조작 때문이다.
조작이 자유롭지가 못하다. 공격을 하면 아주 잠깐 동안 멈추는데, 이 때 움직일 수가 없다.
적들에게 쳐맞기 좋은 타이밍이 된다.
백스텝하는 키도 있는데, 뒤로 너무 멀리 가서 공격하려면 다시 앞으로 와야 되고.
조작이 짜증나면 맞으면서도 불합리하다고 느낀다.

두 번째로, 저장이 힘들다.
조작이 어려우니 난이도도 어려운데, 죽으면 저장한 데서 시작한다.
메트로베니아 게임이니만큼 저장하는 위치가 따로 있다. 근데 이게 굉장히 드물다.
죽으면 저 멀리서 처음부터 다시 시작해야 하는 것이 빡친다.
화남 스택이 많이 쌓여서 죽으면 그냥 꺼버리게 된다.

진짜 열받게 만드는 것도 가지가지 한다.
그래도 메트로베니아 게임은 웬만하면 재미없지 않으므로...
그냥 내가 게임을 못해서 그런가 보다 생각하면, 그리 나쁜 게임은 아니다.
빡침을 견뎌내고 계속 하다보면 레벨업도 하고 좋은 무기도 끼면서 게임에 익숙해진다. 
그러면 할만 하다.

플레이 타임은 11시간 반 정도.
많이 다운그레이드된 '할로우 나이트'로 보면 될 것 같다.
재밌기는 하지만, 초~중반에 불만족스러운 부분이 꽤 있었기에 그다지 추천하지는 않겠다.

진행도: 보통 난이도로 엔딩 봄.
주민 모두 구출함. 보물 상자 모두 안 모음. 
주민들의 퀘스트는 다 안 깸.

플레이 날짜: 2020.11.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024999045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 547, 'last_played': 1605673804}
review:
It's a metroidvania, with an extra focus on the -vania; lots of equipment, rare/uncommon drops from enemies, that sort of thing.

While I appreciate the concept of a randomly generated map, it makes it difficult to find (and refind) all the secrets, mission items, and places you can backtrack with new abilities.  

It would be nice if you could put special markers on places like that; I've been using pen&paper.

Overall there's great variety; variety of enemies each with their own unique movement and attack strategies, variety of equipment, magic and items, and variety of trap rooms that are very engaging to navigate.

I would definitely recommend this on the basis of gameplay for all the above reasons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004154211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1605538993}
review:
So I bought this game a couple of months ago and just left it for later to try it out. Today I saw I have it in my library and thought it's about time to give it a try. 
Well, after an hour I tried my first time to refund a game and had to learn the hard way, that Steam policy for refunding games is that you have to ask for refund no more than two weeks after purchase. Lesson learned.
And about the game? In You could look at the trailer, pictures and think "Well it looks decent for it's price". But you quickly see where all the problems lie. First of all the jumping feels weird. There's like a milisecond delay after you do a big jump, which messes up your rythm. The same thing happens with combat. When you think you found the right pace when to hit enemies and when to retreat it just brings you down like nothing and you're left highly enraged. I tried to finish one part of the so uninspiring cave level for maybe 10 times and there's one goblin guy just keeps throwing rocks nonstop at you and you can't reach him. After I got to him, I fell down in to poison pit and died. It's not hard to be hard, it's hard to be annoying. 
The background doesn't have any paralax or movement, so levels look dull. And they're pretty long for not having anything much to do in them. Enemies respawn immediately when you go to next screen, so don't expect to back track to save point if you're short on lifes. 
The first two new weapons that I got was knife and club, but they don't do much, because you still have to hit enemy two times to kill it (or three times and so). It says "grind" all over it.
In conclusion, if you see it for 5€ or less, I would say it's fair. Not more. Although prepare to be frustrated for most parts of it. Or better just skip it.

review:
Great metroidvania like. Tough and challenging but it rewards skill. A good variety of weapons. Some mechanics could have used a bit more work - it would have been nice if the secondary weapons leveled up with use instead of jewelry. Nice story, but really good pixel art and great responsive gameplay.

The random map generation is a little underwhelming. The rooms are configured to be in slightly different positions, but it doesn't feel like a different map at all. The puzzles and character stories are nice. I especially like the attention to details on having the puzzle clues change instead of keeping them the same (frescos, bells).

author: {'steamid': '76561198262452338', 'num_games_owned': 1861, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1604335554}
review:
[b]Chasm[/b] is an okay little metroidvania with decent pixel art but quite uninspired gameplay and a number of poor design choices.

It plays [i]exactly[/i] like Koji Igarashi's Castlevania games ([b]Symphony of the Night[/b] onwards), the main character in particular controls just like Jonathan Morris from [b]Portrait of Ruin[/b]. You have main weapons such as whips, swords, greatswords, daggers, spears, fist weapons etc on one button and sub-weapons such as knife, axe, boomerang (cross), molotov (holy water), shield (bible) etc on the other button. Sub-weapons are curiously called spells but there are no actual spells in the game, just the renamed Castlevania sub-weapons. And then you have the backdash, slide, double jump etc, again just like in Castlevania.

The story is pretty basic, you arrive at a small mining town and are asked to investigate the mines because there's a monster infestation problem. The village is empty at first but you save NPC's on your journey and they provide various services and give out quests (just like in [b]Order of Ecclesia[/b]). Now, the game is quite short and took me only a little under 9 hours to 100%. There only are 6 areas/tilesets and 7 bosses. The bulk of the playtime was spent backtracking and farming enemies because the drop rates are very low (e.g. I looked up online where to get a better whip and it took 150 kills for the enemy to finally drop it, at Luck 45), not to mention the fact that the game requires you to kill an enemy up to 15 times to unlock its bestiary entry and some of the enemies appear only a few times during the game, so again you're just forced to farm if you want the 100% bestiary.

Apart from that, the main issue with the game is its rogue-like elements. Again, just like with many recent indies procedural generation is used here as a crutch. What makes it worse, levels aren't re-rolled when you die, the seed is permanent per playthrough, so unless you bother replaying this (which is unlikely) the RNG aspect is only a detriment because a lot of the levels are just the same copypasted rooms and hallways in weird combinations. The key items and story progression are all the same but the filler between them is randomly generated per your playthrough. Basically, you get all the downsides of playing a rogue-like game with none of the positives.

And then there's a number of really meanspirited design decisions. The fast travel system is extremely unwieldy. Warp points warp you to a warp room and every area has its own, and you can also teleport between the warp rooms. Late game you have 4 warp rooms and simply going back to town requires walking through a long series of portals, as only the first warp room is connected to town. Same goes for saving your game, only the first warp room has a save point so if you want to save you need to warp to your current warp room, then choose the first warp room from the list, teleport to it, save your game and then do it all in reverse. Town scrolls are very expensive and the number is limited (!) per playthrough. They really wanted you to waste your time walking back and forth for no reason whatsoever.

The pixel art is above average and definitely the highlight of the game, everything is decently animated and looks sharp, although the human faces with their googly eyes look a bit weird. The music, on the other hand, is disappointing, the tracks are basically 10 second loops and both HD and chiptune versions sound mostly awful, with only a few exceptions.

Overall, unless you get it in a bundle (like I did) it's not really worth more than $5 unless you're a massive fan of metroidvanias and must play each Castlevania clone there is. Check out [url=store.steampowered.com/app/692850]Bloodstained[/url] and [url=store.steampowered.com/app/774361]Blasphemous[/url] instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960856271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1604288684}
review:
This game has a lot of things really going for it that make you want to like it but ultimately I found it fairly unenjoyable. The seeded maps is a great idea for a game you'd want to play through multiple times like Zelda but I've strugled to even finish this once. I don't know if it's my seed but there is incredible inconsistancy on difficulty which is ultimately determined by distance between save points as they also restore your health. They have different weapons and magic attacks but mainly because of slugish controls and punishingly long animations by your own character it seems you just pick your longest range weapon and cheapest magic attack and stick with that. The metroidvania type upgrades have been sorely lacking, in my 6 some hours of play the only "new moves" i've gotten is a slide, edge hang, and light which means when you're doing the massive amount of backtracking you don't have any standard new move relief to make it enjoyable or faster. Many enemies are extremely annoying and the level design make it all but impossible to avoid taking damage in certain spots. The platforming is just ok but the controls move tip it to the more unenjoyable side. Finally the game is extremely difficult, reminiscent of old NES games but lacking the control or design expertise that made those enjoyable. 

I wanted to enjoy the game more but for all the smart design choice checkboxes there are more negative implementations.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990036156', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 506, 'playtime_forever': 863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1604249190}
review:
Basically, this is a generic metroidvania with the gimmick of having a computer generate the world similar to how the world is generated in terraria. The algorithm for generating the world is similar to typical roguelike world generators. Unfourtunately, what is supposed to be the selling point of this metroidvania ultimately ends up being its biggest problem. As you can probably imagine, a computer just isn't going to be able to give depth and meaning to a metroidvania world and indeed the world is relatively boring. Still, after several patches from the developers the game has become an enjoyable metroidvania experience and while you may dislike the game at first, once you get to the catacombs things will take a turn for the better.

Aside from this, the artstyle and gameplay is virtually identical to timespinner (yes, it even has time manipulation although that doesn't come until the very end and is the last thing to be unlocked).

The story is decent.

The music is great but unremarkable

The sound effects are OK

Overall, I give this a recommendation if it is on sale.

If you buy this game, make sure you make use of the location tagging functionality in the map.  It is EXTREMELY important that you take full advantage of this in order to avoid having a bad experience playing hide and seek all the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043518902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1193, 'last_played': 1674614538}
review:
Chasm es un juego que esta bien y punto, funciona y listo.

Pero bueno, hay varias cosas menores que no me gustaron:
1) que el mapa sea generado al azar termina resultando en zonas difusas y con muchas areas completamente simetricas, prefiero un mapa bien hecho y listo.
2) Los puntos de guardado son francamente un suplicio, porque salvo algunas excepciones estan en lo que seria el atajo que tambien hace de transporte entre niveles, entonces tenes que cambiar por un portal a un nivel en particular, guardar, volver por el portal y retomar la aventura.
3) La economia ingame es pesima, la mejor forma de conseguir oro es por la maquinita de jackpot porque todo es ridiculamente caro y el oro que se consigue en los niveles es MUY poco. 

Aprobado raspando.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972584572', 'num_games_owned': 1637, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1603344304}
review:
Beaten - 12 hours map 100%

Chasm is a partially procedural metroidvania. 

Pros:
- Art
- Leveling system
- Loot
- Abilities
- General Map / Biome diversity
- Bosses have a good difficulty and creative mix. Not too crazy either way.

Cons:
- The economy.  You can buy potions and food to better your chances, but it costs so much and i just never have it.

Not bad at all. Not amazing, but not bad. Not sure it needs to be procedural, seeing the game is >10 Hours long. But its not bad and map works fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062229107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 950, 'last_played': 1603072275}
review:
First of all, I'm a sucker for a good Metroid-like and I have to say this game wears it's influences on it's sleeve. 

That being said, I picked this game up last Summer on a sale for $9.99 and I got more than 3X my money's worth. It's by no means a perfect game, but it was fun and kept me very engaged until it's conclusion. It also has a killer soundtrack and the spritework is top notch! My only regret is with the map being procedurally generated I did not make note of where specific places were on the map and that led to a lot of wandering around and searching for the right place to go since I couldn't consult a walkthrough for the specific locations.

It may not be everyone's cup of tea, but if you go in with low expectations you may find yourself very very surprised. I know I was!

author: {'steamid': '76561197985969658', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 690, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1602009103}
review: Decent Metroidvania. The combat is decent, although attack animations are too long and the dodge is only backward which is kind of dumb and its only helpful with a few enemies. Theres a ton of backtracking which is to be expected, but most of the items are underwhelming. I explored every area and level and got like 1 strong piece of armor and then 1 strong weapon 30 min before the game was over, the rest i was using standard weapons which are slight upgrades of one another but they don't occur often and same for armor. Gear should be must better and there should be more to get. The worst part is the random gen, which is whats supposed to set this apart but is the dumbest idea for a metroidvania. Many people use guides and wikis with games like these because theres so much backtracking and how easy it is to get lost, but the random gen ruins a lot of that because you can't look a lot up. Also because of the randomness i didn't get a lot of crafting mats and armor pieces that i saw on a walkthrough etc. But since the story and bosses and areas are the same and all thats different is the level layout theres really no reason to play this a second time because its not different enough, so it is bad in most ways and useless in the intended way. Overall though its not a bad castlevania clone. 7.5/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054021577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1634754101}
review:
Unlike some similar minded games, this one has good control responsiveness.

I would recommend to the devs the following:
 1. Create a combo system for the combat (would be so cool to have more than one strike animation)
 2. Right now this sits as a Metroidvania game, if you included heavier puzzle elements (like in-game lore, akin to La Mulana) I think it would really take this game to the next level. On the other hand, La Mulana is not the most accessible game for everyone. If you want to make it more accessible, do a little more improving on the quests/map indicators.

Otherwise this game is a little bit of a nod to many great games, and executed excellently. I have put 10 hours in on the hard difficulty and I've reached what I believe is the final area. Great compact game, and enjoyable game play albeit frustrating at one or two points if you don't think to upgrade your equipment :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198061304549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1620, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1620, 'last_played': 1601021287}
review:
Okay here goes, my review after finally beating the game and completing a large number of the achievements.

Graphics - A 
Pure 32-bit beauty, just like nature intended, even has the CRT scan-lines if you so choose.
Sound - A
I actually preferred the midi/chip-bit sounds over the other version, the fact it lets you choose is a bonus.
Map - C.  
Hear me out, I know this may seem harsh, but here is my take on it.  I spent most of my time backtracking to/from simply blindly navigating through the map looking for the next big press onward.  Save points are not given in a couple areas which makes for some painful traveling in the later portion of the game.  I feel that is cheap designing to force the player to play the game more to earn more gold (which does not exactly come easy) to buy more HP recovery items just to venture around or get that Beastiary log to 100%.
Monsters - A Minus
Typical fanfare we have all come to know and love, each monster has a pattern of sorts, you simply need to figure it out.  The most damage caused to me was when I either got impatient and tried to steam roll them or get that last hit in before they started their attack, that is completely on me.  Each boss, (well I am unsure if the final one does) gives a special item should you beat them without getting hit.  Sounds great, right?  Wait until you 15th, 20th, or 30th time trying to do just that because one errant touch where you literally could not escape negates the ability to get the prize.  Thankfully the developers put a save point very close to each boss (minus the last two), still though, that walk of shame grinds hard on the soul.
Equipment (weapons, armor, accessories) - A Minus.
Items created per the differences of play weapons preferences to a point (one hand versus two hand weapons), the order in which you received some of the weapons however was oddly paced.  Sometimes you may receive a weapon which outclasses many others based upon your play style either too late in game, which I could understand because you don't want to hand a medieval knight a machine gun in a bad sense.  Then there is one weapon which requires you to go through some tedious hoops to get (thank you community for helping out others with this by the way), but once you equip it, it really is not that awesome.  I do wish there was an explanation of what colors meant however.  Bad case in point, you have three types of the same weapon, armor, or trinket; regular (no border), good (blue border/aura around the item's icon), and great (yellow border/aura around the item's icon).  What I did not like was the differences in them.  Too many times I received an item in good or great format that I already had, only to find out one was better than the other by a point or two.  
Gameplay/Movement - B Minus.  Here me out again, I do certainly recommend this game to anyone who is a fan of Metroidvania's.  I would preface this however that they had better prepare for some serious grinding through sometimes meaningless backtracking because the game literally tells you little if anything of merit.  Later on in the game you will get an ability to wall-jump, another staple Metroidvania skill I welcomed greatly.  The collisions on some those wall grabs was dodgy at times as was another ability which would let you float.  Quite a few times I found myself getting hurt or having to completely redo a room (which vary in size) because a button press which should have worked simply did not.  There are a couple puzzles that honestly had a great community not been reporting and sharing their wealth of information, would have left so many of us in the dark unable to move forward.
Achievements - B.  Nice achievements, though I am glad there was not one for "Collect all weapons," or something similar as while you can boost your luck, and even with some interesting tweaking I was over 44 luck but it still feels like World of Warcraft RNG at times.  However, I was not getting credit for some of those achievements I had clearly did to include rescuing everyone, doing their tasks, and completing the map.  While I received help from the developer in regards to getting credit for rescuing them, I still do not have credit for completing their side quests or getting 100% map completion.
Ending - B.  I received what the community calls the "better ending," because I did X sub-tasks in the story.  Cool, but even after having done all that in addition to 100% map completion, my medal was only bronze.  I can only assume it must be a calculation of time.  
Overall:  A Minus, would still recommend for anyone a fan of the genre.  While I have heard the company is looking to make another game, I believe the conjecture was that it may not be another Metroidvania, which saddens me because this team made a great game, of which I wish I could have played for longer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198859617765', 'num_games_owned': 3686, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1601916600}
review:
遊戲玩法與風格類似惡魔城，不過戰鬥操作較為生硬，攻擊後的硬直無法透過緊急退後（Rt鍵）取消，提高難度的同時卻也削弱了動作遊戲靈活度，造成戰鬥變得死板，這是大忌。

而遊戲中時不時出現需要跳躍才能踏立的平台，偶爾會有怪物看見你，便自動守在平台邊緣處，你跳過去就會被打下來。理論上來說，以前我玩的動作遊戲，怪不會一直守在平台邊緣，而是待角色離開怪的視線範圍後，牠會往平台的另一個邊緣處移動，這時我們會馬上跳上平台，並快速移動到怪的背後攻擊。我猜遊戲中的怪似乎有無條件追縱功能，導致一些立足點較小的平台，還有一堆飛行怪靠近，根本很難閃躲。這為你的通關帶來了難度上的提升，卻並不具備挑戰性，反而令人覺得反感。

武器的種類很少，也沒有特殊必殺技，而副武器的使用率其實也不高，從頭到尾甚至能一把劍搞定。另外有一些裝備可以召喚鳥和劍，比方說bird hat，裝備後會有一隻鳥跟著你，並且隨著鳥的升級攻擊力也會增強。但是呢……升級條件卻非常惱人。原因是除非敵人死亡前的最後一擊是鳥去攻擊擊死的，否則無法升級。

等於說，你先殺了敵人，那麼該經驗值歸你，而鳥先殺了敵人，則經驗值歸牠，你們不能供享經驗值。所以為了讓bird hat升級，你還得計算敵人的血量，好讓鳥能給予最後一擊。但問題是鳥的攻擊還有冷卻時間，所以在最後一擊前，你還得等待，然後閃躲敵人的攻擊。

我並不覺得這有什麼挑戰性，只覺得這種設定讓人感到很煩。使得原本應該流暢的動作遊戲，變得生硬、無趣，磨時間。玩到後面會讓人覺得很悶，而不是因為充滿挑戰感到開心，或是享受自由戰鬥靈活動作的快意。而且遊戲封面角色是有裝備盾的，但實際上沒有盾可以裝備。

至於劇情方面，似乎也沒有什麼劇情，減少了吸引你進續向前的動力。從頭到尾就是幾張地圖一直重覆往返。

所以我不推薦這款遊戲，這款只能算中下評。我不曉得它日後是否會改版。

但現階段來說，不推薦。

這款遊戲有潛力，卻沒有完全發揮，導致像是半成品。

author: {'steamid': '76561198049266749', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 767, 'last_played': 1601605069}
review:
The negative reviews at the top are pretty exaggerated and misleading. 

Its definitely a fun little metrodvania platformer. Its easy to recommend for fans of the genre. Especially if you want a lighter experience.  

The story is a tad dry and don't get me wrong its not the best in class but its good. Better then good in many ways. Its got a nice retro feel. Like NES Zelda: 2 turned up to 11.  Theres a nice mix of fairly straight forward exploring and backtracking for secrets. Theres loads of secrets big and small. Theres some cool items, clever elements, and fun surprises. It really achieves alot and was an ambitious project. The game has some replayability and extra challenges if you want to add them. 

It is a tad light and found it pretty easy on the normal difficulty. You could plow through it in a day or two if you rushed. I took about 9 hours but backtracked whenever I could, got 100% explored, and made sure not to miss much of anything. 

I also found the art, sounds, and music enjoyable. Not sure how some are ripping on these elements. Its not hiding its style.

One reviewer said the game got old but I found the end games stages the best. 

Overall I had a great time. I'd love to see it get a sound pass but I doubt that will happen. Some quality of life improvements to save you time would be nice. Maybe some new areas, items, characters. A magic overhaul could be great too. Maybe for Chasm 2 fingers crossed.

Cons:

I was pretty disappointed the characters appearance didn't change the whole game. I like to customize and feel like I'm growing. Tho you do get a little of that from the different weapons. I wanted more. Would been so cool to see the equipment change your appearance.

It get a tad tedious at times. The back tracking. short cuts, and save locations, can be annoying or feel unnecessary. Back tracking through the early stages is not threatening at all.  It could have been a little more dynamic. Like maybe some new enemies populate at certain points. One thing desperately missing and an easy fix would be to be able to save at any portal. Instead you got go in the portal, switch area, then walk over there, then save, then back track to the portal... All extra steps for nothing really. You are just clicking and switching screens for nothing. Also, I wish I knew the map had a marking system sooner. Mark those chests and areas you can't get too it will save you loads of time. 

Mild spoiler, there are invisible walls. They are kinda annoying tho because most of them have boring rewards. Theres also no indication they exist. I found my first one by complete accident. Which made my ocd kick in overdrive. Now I had to check every wall and they were are pretty rare. Only a couple times did it feel worth it and rewarding. More interesting stuff coulda been done with this for sure. 

The magic system is kinda lack luster. Well it does have a retro nes feel but thats kinda dated. They dont really explain it much either. So you gotta buy and try your spells to know how they work. Id really recommend looking them up online before buying any. You'll only want one or two. The magic could be more dynamic for sure. This is one thing I think could really be reworked to add alot to the game. Have some more progression and flavor. Maybe add some secret spells and interactions with items and monsters. 

I should add I only did one play through on normal. I wanna try it on hard or hardcore with the classes add on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012985284', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2093, 'last_played': 1664110761}
review:
Un buen Metroidvania, me ha encantado, pero le faltan muchos pequeños detalles que se agradecerían, por ejemplo:
- Al comprar algo a un mercader, poder ver la cantidad que ya tienes en el inventario.
- Poder cambiar el arma principal sin tener que acceder al menú (con el arma secundaria/mágica sí lo permite).
- Acceso rápido a objetos (pociones, comida, pergaminos...) así como limitar la cantidad máxima de éstos para incrementar la dificultad.
- Simplificar el equipamiento (existen una burrada de items, la mayoría inservibles).
- Poder elegir clase desde el principio.
- Falta un NG+

Por destacar:
- Historia muy simple, pero no necesita más.
- La OST a mi me ha encantado, es simple y un poco repetitiva, pero a su vez es agradable.
- Gran variedad de enemigos.
- El hecho de poder encontrar items con mejor Tier de los enemigos o los cofres (por mi parte he farmeado bastante para conseguir mejor equipamiento en modo Difícil).
- Las mazmorras no se hacen pesadas y hay suficientes salidas/conexiones.
- La dificultad es correcta (en modo difícil he tenido que repetir varias zonas por confiarme)

Recomiendo empezar una partida en difícil y darle una oportunidad al juego. Los desarrolladores están actualizando constantemente.

review: Okay so I play a lot of metroidvanias.  And I really came out enjoying this one.  But before getting into that, about half way through the game, I ended up googling why my save had a seed.  Found an article with a dev saying that you shouldn't even notice the purpose of the seed until you play again.  Supposedly you get all you progression items in the same order every time, but the path you take to get there is what's randomly generated.  This is super cool.  I haven't started a new game yet, but I definitely will.  This was a great game and comes highly recommended if you are in to the genre.

review:
An ok metroidvania. It has nice variety both in environments as in enemies, but there are some things that just don't seem polished. Combat is ok... platforming is ok... story is ok... it's just ok, it fails to impress and can become boring feeling more like a chore sometimes. It feels like it's missing something, and for me beating the bosses seemed to bring not much of the satisfaction you'd expect from a boss encounter.
It is not a bad game, but I can not recommend it being a "just ok" game

author: {'steamid': '76561197993153552', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1601240454}
review:
J'ai trouvé ce jeu sympathique en terme de gameplay, car très ressemblant à un Metroidvania.
Il est vraiment cool, le système de SEED quand on crée une partie est original, mais n'était pas nécessaire.
Car malgré la seed unique par partie, à mon avis le déroulement reste le même, juste le layout change.

Bref, le jeu se termine assez vite, il est pas très dur. Cependant beaucoup de backtracking, parfois un peu chiant, mais bien géré avec le système de téléportation.

Les combats, équipements, armes secondaires est comme un Castlevania récent (comme Aria of Sorrow) et le gameplay est fluide et se prend bien en main.

Un petit jeu que je conseille si on veut juste faire un Metroidvania sans se prendre la tête.

review: Liking it every bit as much as Sundered or SteamWorld Dig or any other pixel-art game of its type.  It's sort of an Action RPG slash platformer.   Upgrades, level-ups, and a sort of metroidvania kinda setup to the main dungeon that you go down into as you attempt to branch out to new areas and rescue the townsfolk of the town that serves as a central hub.  Definitely gives a lot of playtime for its price.   Worth delving into this chasm.

review:

review: The gameplay is decent, kind of castlevania-esque, however the actual action is very stiff and it is difficult to have much creativity with your equipment. The main menu is also not formatted very well. For a game where if you die you go back to the main menu, you would think the cursor would start on the file in which you were playing on, but instead it always goes back to the first file which makes it so that when you are trying to get back into the game because you died to a boss and want to rush back in to complete the boss battle, you instead select another file and have to go back to the start menu again.

review: If you like fun, you might like this game. author: {'steamid': '76561197995574372', 'num_games_owned': 3021, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 1857, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1857, 'last_played': 1600198428}
review:
Of the many Metroidvania games that I've played, this is one of my favorites. The combat is fun (if a little easy), with bosses and enemies all having nice patterns that can be read and exploited while still allowing for different playstyles. 

Beating the game once will unlock class mode, which lets you play with new fun classes, and the warrior. This is where the real fun starts. 
The rogue is a glass cannon that moves faster (to the point that it's hard to go back to other characters afterwards, by the by), gets a bonus to knives, has a backstab ability that also works on magic attacks, and has a massive luck stat that lets him make up for his weak damage by getting all the good loot with super powerful bonuses on all of them by late game, plus rolling in money because you'll have more stuff than you want to bother selling by the time you hit the end boss. 
The mage is a lot of fun, though trickier to play. He has a bit more health, casts spells at a discount, and favors a more strategic hit and run tactics. If you're farming achievements then the mage is your best bet for the 'Kill a boss without taking a hit' achievo. Side note: Whips work really well for the mage, since your damage is terrible so reach is really important. Also really useful for breaking lights, which can drop mana orbs and taking out trash mobs in the early areas when you're backtracking.
The warrior...exists. He has a lot of health, swings two handed weapons a smidge faster than everyone else, gets more base damage, and has virtually no luck so he gets very few monster drops, meaning that you're basically never going to get any of the fun toys or good enchantments. I can't imagine actually playing through the game with this character, but the other two are really good.

Unfortunately, after the second or third play through the game starts to wear a bit thin (though at about 10 hours a pop it holds up really well for the price). The random levels aren't random enough and the random rooms can be recycled multiple times in the same play through. There's a chance you'll get cool hidden areas with good loot, but there's a chance you won't and the 'good loot' isn't guaranteed even if you do. And the game also lacks a New Game+ mode, which means all of the really cool late game gear that you go through a lot of hoops to find and savescum good drops of will be in your hands for about 5 minutes before the end boss. 

Still, tldr: I had a blast playing this through three times to 100% it. Casual players will get about 10 fun hours out of it, so if you like the genre then I'd highly recommend it. It can feel a little light on content after you play through it enough, but the first time through feels great.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966362365', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1603925770}
review:
I've visited Chasm on and off for years now since I stumbled across it during the Kickstarter campaign.  Backing the Kickstarter and being a big SotN fan makes me super biased.  When it released they had an offer to pay an extra $5 to get it for PS4, so that's where I put most of my time.  I just fired it up in Steam to delight my eyeballs with the amazing pixel art and the daily challenge works great in their procedurally generated level design.  In the main campaign or story I don't care as much for the procedurally generated concept because I like the returning to a familiar world.

I'll have to play through it again one of these days because it looks like a lot has changed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007227151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 1263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1597863859}
review:
[h1]Качественная метройдвания с нотками RPG и rouge-like[/h1]
Почему стоит играть:
Есть такое выражение: "Если не можешь придумать что-то революционно новое, то возьми имеющееся и сделай не хуже". Разработчики с большой ответственностью подошли к нему и создали некий сплав из метройдвании, рогалика и action RPG (прокачка + экипировка) без изобретения велосипеда. Всё что в игре есть сделано крайне качественно: приятная глазу картинка (pixelart с плавными анимациями), рабочие механики (сражения, прокачка, архитектура уровней), прекрасная музыка, приятная сложность (в некоторых моментах бросающая вызов).

Почему не стоит играть:
В игре отсутствует что-то новое. Это всё уже где-то было и какой-то новый игровой опыт она не сможет предложить.

review:
+ Very nice graphics and mood
+ Soundtrack is good
+ Decent variety of enemies
+ Challenging
+ Tight controls overall
+ Fast travel system is very handy
+ Interesting upgrades and controls; doesn't feel like a straight clone of anything

- Somewhat repetitive room layouts
- Randomized maps limits ability to share strategies with friends/blogs
- Difficult to backtrack because of random maps and "canned" layouts
- Secrets are too hidden; some hints would make it more fun
- Not a huge variety of items to purchase or find

Overall its really good and I would love to see a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076219837', 'num_games_owned': 3116, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 1638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1638, 'last_played': 1598499445}
review:
Chasm fácilmente podría ser otro juego de castlevania de la época de GBA y DS, toma prestado muchas convenciones de los castlevanias post SotN y casi que la mayoría de las armas presentan animaciones casi iguales a las que esos juegos tenían. El twist que le ofrece Chasm a la formula de estos juegos, es que la mayoria del mapa y el posicionamiento de los enemigos es, hasta cierto grado, generado aleatoriamente, lo cual le da cierto nivel de rejugabilidad, pero también, le mete elementos de frustración causada por el RNG.

Lo bueno:
+Lindo pixelart.
+El sistema de combate es casi identico al  de los castlevanias que ya mencioné.
+El sistema de loot es sin duda la mejor parte del juego, dadoq ue cada arma tiene un drop rate determinado, pero cada item tiene la probabilidad de tener stats excelentes o pasables, me gusta esto porque si te gusta un arma, puedes farmear mejores versiones de esta y prácticamente terminar el juego con dicha arma.

Lo malo:
-El RNG puede causar frustración.
-El sistema de teleport no es malo, pero es un poco complicado para mi gusto.
-El oro es virtualmente inútil.

¿Lo recomiendo?
La verdad si, si te llaman la atención los metrodivanias y ves este juego en sale, por 2 o 3 dólares, vale la pena, es divertido pero ocasionalmente frustrante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089350994', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1600186296}
review:
Bonjour, potentiel acheteur qui lit cette évaluation,

Pour commencer, c'est encore un jeu qui mérite (selon moi, évidemment) un bouton avis partagé car il y a des plus et il y a des moins qui font de ce jeu, un jeu moyen.

Pour situer le gameplay, cela ressemble à Hollow Knight car il n'y a pas de combo d'attaque. C'est un coup et c'est tout. Certains aiment, d'autres non. Pour moi ce n'est qu'une mécanique de gameplay qui est moyenne car cela dépend essentiellement de comment le jeu est agencé à côté, esquive, sort (s'il y en a), etc.

Donc pour les bons points,

Les graphismes sont beaux, y a rien à dire c'est beau. C'est du pixel art mais c'est joli. (Après si vous n'aimez pas le pixel art pourquoi tu t'emmerdes à lire ?)
La diversité des armes et des sorts est sympa, elle permet à chacun de trouver son style de jeu.
Une assez large éventail d'ennemis aux parterns différents, c'est toujours sympa de varier les plaisirs.
Le manque d'indications concernant les point de sauvegarde est dommageable car il pourra vous arriver de mourir après avoir exploré une grosse partie de la carte juste parce que vous avez continué tout droit au lieu de monter dans la salle de sauvegarde.

Pour les points bof,

La musique, elle a beau être sympa après 3h de jeu, j'avais mal à la tête.
L'esquive, on a vu mieux. Elle n'est pas inutile mais souvent trop courte ou trop longue.
Les paterns d'attaque de votre personnage. Et oui, malheureusement, la variété d'arme amène aussi un problème qui devient vite apparent, certaines armes sont équivalentes à un suicide. Les armes qui n'ont aucune portée ne sont quasiment pas utilisable en jeu puisque vous ne pourrez soit pas vous approcher suffisamment pour attaquer soit vous ne pourrez pas esquiver.
Le système de porte pour ce balader dans un niveau sans se taper tout le niveau est bien mais il en manque quelques unes à mon goût.
Il y a des salles cachés mais il n'y a aucun indice pour les trouver, la plupart on tombe dessus par hasard en essayant de se rattraper lors d'une chute ou en grimpant.
Le changement de difficulté est presque inutile car seul les points de vie des ennemis changent, du moins c'est la seule chose que j'ai remarqué. Donc puisque l'on prend toujours la même quantité de dégât et au vue des défauts du jeu, la difficulté facile n'apparaît même pas comme plus simple juste moins longue.

Enfin, pour les mauvais points du jeu,

C'est étonnamment long pour un jeu si court. Je n'ai pas fini le jeu et je n'ai pas 25h sur le jeu pourtant, ces 5h m'ont paru longue et chiante à en crever, là où Hollow Knight compense avec une bonne B.O. et des paysages qui changent régulièrement ici beaucoup de salle sont réutilisés ce qui donne vite la sensation de ne pas avancer. Combinez à cela, les aller-retours à faire entre 2 ou 3 zones après le déblocage d'une compétence et c'est vite lassantet le respawn intensif des monstres qui ajoute encore un peu à la recette car à chaque changement de sale l'équipe technique est remise à neuf et quand votre but est uniquement de passer à travers une zone c'est vite chiant même quand il ne faut qu'un seul coup pour tuer un monstre.
L'argent peut aussi devenir un problème car avec les problèmes d'esquive et les attaques parfois inesquivables des monstres votre vie aura une fâcheuse tendance à descendre et à descendre vite. Or, les potions et la nourriture ne sont pas un drop courant, il faudra généralement les acheter au village lorsque les personnages pouvant vous proposer potion ou nourriture auront été libéré. Sinon vous devez faire des passages aux points de sauvegarde éparse pour regagner votre vie et avec ce qui a été dit au dessus c'est parfois difficile.
Certaines attaques sont inesquivable, je l'ai déjà dit mais je le redis certains monstres ne peuvent pas être esquiver et pour d'autre, il faudra vous préparez à un long combat car vous ne mettrez pas souvent de coup et ce sont parfois des sacs à point de vie.

En conclusion, ce jeu est un mixe entre un jeu de plateformes et un RPG et c'est pas dingue. Ce n'est pas mauvais mais des défauts viennent alourdir le gameplay et la progression du joueur. Si c'était un jeu de plateforme, il serait très bon mais en tant que RPG, c'est pas fou. On va juste de droite à gauche ou de haut en bas en tapant sur tout ce qu'on croise et les seules notions de RPG viennent des niveaux que l'ont peu gagner en tuant suffisamment de monstres et de l'inventaire et c'est tout.

Edit : Non, ce n'est pas pour dire que le jeu est bien, mais pour rajouter un détail, le level designer est une ordure. Le nombre de phase de plateforme que tu dois te taper avec des monstres aériens ou terrestres qui sont juste bien placé pour que si t'essaie d'aller un peu vite tu te le manges et tu redescend tout en bas de la salle ou bien tu ne peux juste pas monter, au mieux sans prendre de dégât au pire tu te faite enchaîner en boucle jusqu'à ce que l'IA décide qu'elle en a marre de te pourrir. Comment on peut rendre un jeu avec un tel potentiel aussi frustrant ? Y a rien qui va, le wall jump est à vomir, les phases de plateformes serait assez simple s'il n'y avait pas toujours un détail frustrant mis de façon ostentatoire histoire de te rappeler que t'es pas là pour t'amuser !  Et pour ceux qui ont mis une recommandation avec seulement 1h de jeu aller bien vous faire mettre parce que le jeu vous y avez pas joué. Entre le level designer sadique, l'inflation concernant les objets de survie (potions et nourriture) et la pauvreté des drops je vous jure que le jeu vous y avez pas joué d'ailleurs rien que quand j'ai vu le pourcentage de joueur qui ont tué le 2é boss j'ai compris.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202172446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1598948785}
review:
[h1]TL;DR: Do not buy. Game looks nice on outside, but everything about is pretty much terrible.[/h1]

Steam has a lot of good platformers available, and this is not one of them.

There is so many flaws that it is hard to imagine that someone would release such game without noticing.

This is a good example of how you should NOT make a platformer.

[h1]A short list of SOME of problems of the game:[/h1]

1. Clumsy controls. Any time you want to do some action, you cannot do it swiftly. You either need to press some awkward combination of keys, or you just can't.
i.e. if you run and want to slide while you run, you need to  sit down and stop first, only then press a slide button to slide. Almost any action is clumsy and just pain.

2. Terrible main attack. It is just disgusting. First of all - there is no combos, just 1 plain attack. And it has a HUGE recovery time. So you do your attack and then stand still for half a second during which you cannot do nothing.
Basically your character just gets microstuns every time you do an attack, well, because he is special, I suppose. If you want to be somewhat mobile, you will be forced to do a dodgy combination of jump-attack-land-jump-attack-dodge, spamming z-x-zx with a tight timing.
This way you will manage to eliminate this dumb recovery time. And it does not looks like an intended strat, rather than some lag abuse.

3. Terrible enemy animations. They are just nonsense. Basically anyone just rushes into you without any anticipatory movement whatsoever. One second the guy just stands still, and the other one he is moving towards you with an insane speed.
You will basically have no time to react whatsoever.
There IS a prepare attack animation but it is played 1-3 second before the actual attack, which makes it useless, because you will be forced to remember a timing for every single enemy.

4. Enemies itself. Bosses are piss weak and airborne enemies fly away and attack you with ranged attack from where you cannot reach them. Rest of enemies is just boring.

5. Plot. You will need to read a shitton of boring text notes in order to understand anything. It gets annoying very quickly and you will just quit reading it at some point.

6. Trade mechanics, NPCs - you will be broke AF all the time, and sometimes you will manage to save some money to buy an item that will be useful for 15 mins, because you will find a better one in dungeon already.
Of course items sold for a 10-20% of their original cost.
There are some tokens that will allow you to random some gold, if you lucky you get a 10% of a usual item cost, if not then nothing.

7. Teleport system is just something. It looks like devs just trolling. Why not create a usual teleport/bonfire which allows you to fast travel? No, instead you need to walk into main cave, enter the next room, which has entrance to the mines subhub, in which there IS a teleport, which you can use to teleport to the gardens/castle/other subhub, from which you could exit at the point you need to. Ugh, just why???

8. Art style looks nice at first but it becomes annoying quite quickly. It is simply not competitive.

9. Death mechanics. You just die. Yep.

10. Terrible true random mechanics in game where you can save. I.e. slot machine near save. There is a scroll that gives you 1 random stat point, so, you could just random it, or, if you want to choose which stat to up - roll it near save point. Yeah, why not ask a player which stat to up, rather than up a random one and give a save point. Nice.
Basically either get a shit stat, or suffer to get one you want.

11. Terrible stats and item mechanics in general. There are 4 stats and they don't really fit into the game.


There is a lot more of terrible things to this game that I forgot to mention.

If you want to have a good time, just buy any other platformer game, not this one, this one will only bring you frustration and boredom.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992960689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 1158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1592966690}
review:
This is a charming little metroidvania that feels deliberately measured in its powerups and more down-to-earth than many (it lacks the crazy sci-fi tech of Metroid, and most of the gonzo magic of Castlevania), but that's part of the charm. It seems to aim for a decidedly steampunkish flavour, and does pretty well at that.

The graphics are charming and would look right at home on a SNES or a GBA. It's not all that difficult a game, which is good if you're just looking for a casual experience (as I often am). If it has higher difficulty, I didn't bother to look for it in the settings.

The completionist will find a great deal of grinding ahead of themselves, in that there are lots of enemy types in the game to fill in your bestiary, and most of them have multiple random drops for you to find in order to finish filling out their stat blocks. Some of said drops are rare, and quite powerful upgrades, as I found out on a few occasions, so might be worth it, but not really necessary. While I did die a fair bit, it never felt overly punishing, and that's probably why I was fine to just get killed on a whim, looking for secrets, or pushing ahead without better gear. If I took a more cautious approach and spent more time crafting, I likely would have died much less often.

On that note, the crafting system is simple, but it does give you something else to do, complimenting the grinding process a bit. Not only is there weapon and armour crafting, but you can also make food and potions. Plenty to do here.

I got nearly 20 hours out of it, which seems fair, and while I didn't complete all entries in my bestiary, nor complete all crafting, I'd recommend that you get it on sale. I'm the last one to suggest that indie devs compete in a race-to-the-bottom on pricing, even with the lovingly crafted pixel art, and reasonably engaging gameplay, I don't think this game is on the same level as some others at this price point, such as Axiom Verge, but it's still GOOD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157793525', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1598497350}
review:
I love retro style RPG games, so this really caught my eye. Kudos to the devs for making some nice animations as well. 

Sadly, I find myself roaming the same corridors with no real guidance for where to go next, and let me tell you there is a lot of ground to explore. You get new abilities and tools as time goes on but you have to discover for yourself where to find them. All I find are screens with a barrier I cannot pass because I lack the respective ability/tool. After exploring the entire available map 3 or 4 times (literally), I miraculously discovered a new task that (wait for it) sends me on a scavenger hunt around the entire map! 

If you have absolutely nothing better to do, this might be for you. But for me, it is far too boring and monotonous running the same screens and killing the same enemies until I find something new by mistake.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049002023', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1634162700}
review:
It's challenging to return to classic Metroids when so many games that have been inspired by those trailblazing NES/SNES titles have brought many modern conveniences and mechanics to the genre. Hollow Knight, Ori, Steamworld Digs - to name a few, have been the modern metroidvanias I've enjoyed. Chasm ranks right up there with Steamworld as an accessible, enjoyable exploration and platforming experience. The back-step mechanic assists in dodging enemy attacks, and there's a hint of souls-like weapon knowledge; big weapons hit harder but swing slower; you've got to time your attacks appropriately.

I only wish there were auto-saves, but that's my anger at dying after not pinging a save point for a half-hour.

review: I feel like this game isn't getting enough love. I just finished it and I really enjoyed it. It wasn't too hard, but it wasn't wicked easy either. I felt like it was a nice easy going kind of action RPG that doesn't require a ton of grinding. I'm glad I held off on this one until the most recent update where from what I have gathered the devs seem to have fixed most of the issues people had with the earlier version of the game. The graphics are nicely done and there is a large variety of enemies which I was happy to see. The music is also very nice with an optional chiptune version. The game never gets too tedious because it's not very long. It's a very short but sweet old style action RPG that isn't trying to be something it isn't. If you go into it expecting anything more than that (which I don't know why you would bother buying this game if the trailer doesn't intrigue you since what you see is what you get) then you will be pleased. Not the best Metroidvania I have ever played (Hollow Knight, Ori, Bloodstained and Blasphemous are all better) but it is far from the worst.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134427466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1112, 'last_played': 1639669695}
review:
[h1] Introdução [/h1]
Bem... O que dizer de [b]Chasm[/b]? Um metroidvania bem mais do mesmo que não apresenta grandes inovações, mas não falha em muitos aspectos. Essa falta de falhas, que pode ser representada por conta do jogo ser bem igual aos demais e repetir tudo que dá certo nos demais.
Nunca fui muito fã do gênero e nunca me dediquei à ele, porém, vendo outras avaliações dizendo que Chasm era um jogo bem mais do mesmo, aproveitei que estava em promoção e comprei pra me divertir com um jogo básico, e o resultado foi bom. Gostei do que vi, e gostei do tanto que me empenhei pra descobrir as coisas que descobri durante minha jogatina. E se já tive um resultado bom com um jogo bem genérico... Fico animado pros títulos grandes do subgênero metroidvania.

[h1] História [/h1]
Uma história que, é bem mais do mesmo, além de ser bem batida e que, dependendo do tipo de joga que você tá acostumado à jogar, pode até estar de saco cheio de ver. E o final, que poderia apostar em algo diferente pra quebrar essa linha genérica que a história estava seguindo... Apenas pôs a cereja em cima do bolo de coisa que todo mundo tá enjoado de ver.

[h1] Mecânicas [/h1]
Não tem nada muito inovador, tirando o fato que o jogo te põe pra buscar as mecânicas à mais que o seu personagem, geralmente, já vem aprendido. Nadar, escalar, segurar em beiradas e até mesmo pulo duplo, estão por sua conta de serem encontrados pelo mapa e aproveitar de tais benefícios.
Por um lado, gera frustração de não conseguir passar de certas partes logo de cara quando você as encontra. Porém, isso acaba funcionando como uma faca de dois gumes, porque... Quando você consegue encontrar as ferramentas que te permitem passar de uma parte do mapa que não conseguia antes, você volta lá com, além de vontade de passar por algo que não conseguia antes, uma curiosidade ainda maior do por que o jogo te fez esperar tanto por esse momento.

[h1] NPC's [/h1]
Outra coisa no jogo que você precisa ir encontrando aos poucos. O motivo? Bem, o jogo vai te dizer isso, então compre-o para saber.
Nenhum deles é extremamente essencial pra sua campanha, e a maior parte só serve pra você conseguir a conquista de "Complete todas as missões secundárias dos NPCs". Em específico, apenas a NPC que faz poções vai ser útil do momento que você encontra ela até o fim do jogo. Até porque... Todo mundo precisa carregar um pouco de vida e mana extra consigo na mochila.

[h1] Mapa [/h1]
Sempre que você mata o último boss importante daquele ambiente, você libera o próximo. E cada um tem sua variedade própria de inimigos e mini-bosses que, dependendo do momento do jogo que você estiver, vão te fazer suar um pouquinho para serem enfrentados.
Digo isso, pois, à partir de certa parte do jogo, eu estava tão forte que eu só ficava parado na frente do boss tomando todo dano possível, sem nem precisar recuperar nem esquivar de nenhum golpe, batendo nele até o coitado morrer. O que também, não demorava muito. Então... É... Vai de você escolher a build certa pra escolher se você quer economizar tempo ou não matando bichos e bosses pelo mapa.

[h1] Inimigos [/h1]
Alguns poucos são bem, bem irritantes. Por exemplo: A aranha da Fortaleza. O cogumelo dos Jardins. O gladiador do Templo. Os Kobolds das Minas. Enfim, bem poucos são de fato irritantes à ponto de você simplesmente só querer ignorar eles à querer o XP que eles podem te render.
A grande maioria são até bem feitos, tem uma arte bem legal, e uma mecânica ligeiramente única dentro do próprio jogo. Mas, claro, nada de tão inovador se você já é um mestre em metroidvanias.

[h1] Bosses [/h1]
Cada "mapa", "ambiente", "local" diferente tem o seu próprio "main boss". Quando você mata ele, como dito anteriormente, você está habilitado para partir para o próximo. Além disso, você encontra vários mini-chefes pelo caminho. Muitos deles... Do nada. Sério. Às vezes você só tá voltando de uma sala e um boss aparece no caminho... Enfim.
Muitos deles são criativos, e aqui vale algumas menções: O Titan, o Wendigo, o Gnarlox, o Espectro e por fim, o Xamã.
O jogo tem dois bosses especiais mesmo pra história. No caso, um rei que enlouqueceu, e o motivo dele ter enlouquecido. O tal rei e o boss final, que, como dito anteriormente, foi o motivo dele ter enlouquecido, não estão nas menções de bosses interessantes porque... O rei simplesmente não é, e o boss final do game é obrigação de ser... Então... É.

[h1] Considerações finais [/h1]
Bem... Não compre fora de promoção. Não vale o preço cheio de jeito algum!
Compre caso você não tenha mais nada pra jogar, e queira se divertir com um jogo metroidvania mais-do-mesmo. Ou então, caso não seja familiarizado com o gênero, compre para ver o que um jogo metroidvania pode te apresentar. Caso goste, faça como eu. Use ele de ponte para títulos maiores, e melhor produzidos!

author: {'steamid': '76561198122699896', 'num_games_owned': 961, 'num_reviews': 318, 'playtime_forever': 1135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1597864689}
review:
I completely understand the flack this game gets.

First a warning, no resolution works with ultrawide monitors, you're always going to have at least small black bars on all sides of the screen and 1080p does have them but stretches the image so everything looks fat. The best resolution is 1600x900. 2K and 4K look horrible.

Kudos to the artists, the game and animations look gorgeous, but whoever planned gameplay and progression SHOULD be FIRED, real incopetence right there. Drop rates are miserable, attack animations take longer than they should to force you to never miss or be punished for it, you're saving people left and right and none of them even reward you.

Even the first enemies you first meet require dozens of kills to get one of their drops, and if you want drops from bosses guess what, the only way is to not get any damage when fighting them.

There is contact damage when touching enemies, which ok no biggie, BUT the damage is the same as if you get hit by their attack which is completely insane.

One of the worst offenders, there is no mana regen at all, you're stuck having to hit lamps to get mana back, who the hell though anyone would like this nowadays? Can't you have an original idea?

I still enjoy playing it, even if it's a half baked metroidvania, one of the good things about it is that collectibles get marked on the map so it's easy to backtrack, unlike in many out there. 

The soundtrack and even sound effects are all low quality and boring, in no way they represent the harsh combat system in which you can easily die before you even realize it.

The game would have been much better if they divided it into missions in other regions instead of cramping everything under a single mine in a small town, there was so much potential here, make the fort the central hub and then create a series of places with quests, it would also give them plenty of space to add more to the game via updates or even DLC.

The game has a lot of wasted potential, if you love metroidvanias play it at least once, but don't expect anything even near to the same experience you can get from playing bloodstained, for me this game is a 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198021794395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1873, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1873, 'last_played': 1597268899}
review:
Comfy and nice looking game. Ran smoothly and bug free, well made. Felt it was a bit on the easy side (played thru on hard once and almost compleded a 2nd run on nightmare permadeath, died while farming items and not paying attention lol) Game is procedurally generated but on my 2nd run i had to check if i had the same seed because i couldent really tell any difference, dont think i ran into any new rooms or events on my 2nd run.

 I would have preferred if it was not procedural, dont think it adds anything to the game, an all handcrafted experience would probably have been better. Also wish it would have a bit more exploration, bigger world and less linearity, now you just complete one zone, then go to the next, get new tool, backtrack and get chests using new tool and so on. Other than that it was a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067973363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1596401776}
review:
Very enjoyable Castlevania-esque game. The gameplay was fluid, the upgrades you find actually add elements to the game and unlock new areas along with allowing you to reach secrets you couldn't before, giving a reason to backtrack to the earlier levels. The fast travel system worked really well and you rarely had to do a bunch of pointless travelling to get to where you needed to go. It was also reasonably challenging. Fun, but not too easy.

The story was pretty simple. There might have been a deeper lore behind the cave, but it came in the form of huge blocks of text which I didn't read. Oh well.

Anyway, I highly recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156713739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1596908618}
review:
[h1]Слабоватенькая игра![/h1]
 Первое, что стоит сказать, я не знал, ни о Kicktarter, ни о обещаниях. Увидел скриншоты и оружие, вспомнил castlevania ( именно с ней и все сравнивают данный проект ), не хотел покупать из за средненьких отзывов. И вот чудо, а точнее все тот же мой любимый humblebundle, где и появился бандл за доллар с ней. 
 Купил не задумываясь и решил сыграть. Обычно, пишу обзоры только после прохождения игры ( или в случае, когда не понравилась и она уходит в корзину ), но в этой много моментов, которые хочется сразу сказать, ибо потом забуду, скорее всего.
Давайте с плюсов
[olist]
    [*]Симпатичная пиксельная графика
    [*]Отличное, отзывчивое управление
    [*]не напрягающая музыка на заднем фоне и симпатичный задник с заходом солнца в начале игры ( прост чего то вспомнилось :D )
[/olist]
Ну, в общем все, поехали по минусам:
[olist]
    [*]Первое, и самое важное - ее особенность и есть ее главный косяк. Обьясняю: разработчики обещали полностью генерированный мир при каждом новом запуске игры новый случайный мир. Это вроде классно, да? Но нет. Если в том же Rogue Legacy было сложно играть и умирали вы буквально от всего (понятно, если вы не супер-пупер-прогеймерэвер ), то тут мобы ужасно слабенькие. То, чего я больше всего не люблю во многих играх - кликер. Все правильно, большинство мобов и даже первый босс, да и второй в общем то просто закликиваются. Нет, конечно, прыгать и уворачиваться вам хотя бы минимально надо, но все же...
    [*]Постоянное чувство, что я уже все это видел и во все это играл, несмотря на то, что легендарную castlevania SoN я не прошел и играл в целом мало
    [*]Однообразные локации. И еще важный момент для меня, в сюжетных metroidvania(h) все-таки есть секреты, а секреты это очень и очень круто! Ну круто же!? Так вот, тут их нет, опять таки все из за той же генерации...
[/olist]
 Как бы, после моих любимых Hollow Knight, Salt and Sanctuary и еще многих других, эта мне не понравилась, но она и не очень плоха. Имеется несколько подземелий, быстрые переходы, магазины... Вот пишу и понимаю, что это везде есть лол.
 Из вдохновителей Castlevania я бы очень советовал bloodstained curse of the moon, хоть она и очень коротенькая, но все же Кодзи Игараси был также и создателем той самой Castlevania. Так как есть много хороших игр в данном жанре, эту я все-таки не рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198802766576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2098, 'last_played': 1634433709}
review:
In general it's a good game, I like the similarities it has to Castlevania and Metroid (which justifies the tag associated to the game), the world is  randomly generated (although I can't say for sure to which extent this functions) and it's seed based which means that you can just save the info for the generated world that you got in the past and felt confortable with/thought it was easier and quicker for you, when I bought it I had a blast, kept playing and trying to discover its secrets and level up for hours every day, the leveling up after some time was boring, but worth it since I was using a specific sword which its stats grow whenever you kill an enemy.

But it's a quick game, naturally it requires backtracking if you intend to gain certain items and upgrades (the main upgrades being, as far as I know, mandatory for story progression, the reason for the "as far as I know" part is because I didn't tried to finish it without first trying to get everything that was possible).

When it comes down to fighting, most enemies have a set attack and movement pattern with little variation which is good since this will help anyone trying to pass any part, this really comes into play when fighting bosses since the game actually rewards you with a powerful item (and achievements) every time you kill a boss without losing any health in the fight, some of these items (most of them being weapons (with one exception) imo are useful but to a certain extent defined by your personal needs or the strenght they give you in certain parts of the dungeons.

[spoiler] There is a new game plus mode which gives you the possibility to choose specific classes to play with, these classes do not restrain (at least in a forced way) the usage of some weapons and armor, but they change stats growth, which means that an weapon that raises your magic stat won't be all that useful if you chose to play as a Thief or a Warrior (or Knight, don't really remember the specific name for the strenght centered class) for example. There's a sort of "roguelike mode" in the game as well in which after dying the game erases the world you just made. Right now I don't remember more aspects to this NG+ option however, sorry for that. [/spoiler]

To end this quick review, you will certainly be able to finish this game in way less than 35 hours (which is my record to the day when I'm writing this) and I say that because I grinded too much, all the money I've earned was overkill, at the end of the game I already bought almost everything I wanted to and still had a lot of money even after spending thousands on potions, the problem with time spent on grinding might show up when fighting enemies to acquire specific items required to upgrade your equipment. if you want a game to have some hours of fun, I truly believe that you will be amused by it (even if it's just slightly), but if you're looking for something that's completely inovative I don't believe there is. It's worth buying it if you already were willing to for the full price, but if you just have a mild curiosity for the game and haven't decided yet, then wait some time for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011097396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1596920914}
review: Chasm is an underrated game. I was drawn to it by the charming character art and was satisfied to find that all of the art is top notch. Even the idle animations give so much personality. It is among the best pixel art out there and for that reason alone this could be worth a play. The music is also good - but there aren't too many tracks so I found that after a long session I would still be looping it in my head afterwards. The game lasted me 16 hours for a 100% complete run (not counting achievements for runs on higher difficulties or without getting hit). There are lots of secrets to discover if you are so inclined. The only negative I have is that late game can get a bit confusing where to go next and I had to resort to the discussion board to get a hint. The reviews critiquing low drop rates have valid points - but farming drops is really only necessary if getting hit too much or going for a no death run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116295819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 638, 'last_played': 1596721750}
review:
One of the worst Castlevania clones out there.

The first hours of the game were great, but it just went downhill afterwards.  I believe the RNG of maps generated is to create replay value or variables, but it's the same reason that ultimately make this game failed to be a hit.  Too focused on precision platforming and it's way more tedious and annoying than fun to play in a metroidvania.  

It's not a poorly done game, I'll give you that.  However, all of the designs and executions missed the mark by a lot, making the whole experience very boring, annoying, tedious, tiresome,  intolerable, a chore to play, and ultimately... not an enjoyable game.

CASTLEVANIA WAS NEVER ABOUT CONSTANT PRECISE DOWN TO THE LAST MILLISECOND PLATFORMING OVER AND OVER JESUS CHRIST
